column2: "At BMC trust is not just a word - it's a way of life!"? We are an award-winning, equal opportunity, culturally diverse, fun place to be. Giving back to the community drives us to be better every single day. Our work environment allows you to balance your priorities, because we know you will bring your best every day. We will champion your wins and shout them from the rooftops. Your peers will inspire, drive, support you, and make you laugh out loud!? We help our customers free up time and space to become an Autonomous Digital Enterprise that conquers the opportunities ahead - and are relentless in the pursuit of innovation!The IZOT product line includes BMCs Intelligent Z Optimization & Transformation products, which help the worlds largest companies to monitor and manage their mainframe systems. The modernization of mainframe is the beating heart of our product line, and we achieve this goal by developing products that improve the developer experience, the mainframe integration, the speed of application development, the quality of the code and the applications security, while reducing operational costs and risks. We acquired several companies along the way, and we continue to grow, innovate, and perfect our solutions on an ongoing basis. BMC is looking for a highly motivated and results oriented Sr MLOps Developer to join our growing AI/ML team. You will be responsible for the entire lifecycle of GEN AI solutions, from model development and deployment to monitoring and performance optimization. You will work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery and operation of AI-powered solutions.? Here is how, through this exciting role, YOU will contribute to BMC's and your own success:?  As every BMC employee, you will be given the opportunity to learn, be included in global projects, challenge yourself and be the innovator when it comes to solving everyday problems.  Design and implement cloud solutions, build MLOps on cloud (OCP, AWS, Azure, or GCP)  Build CI/CD pipelines orchestration by GitHub Actions or similar tools.?  Data science model review, run the code refactoring and optimization, containerization, deployment, versioning, and monitoring of its quality.?  Design and implement MLOps pipelines for GEN AI solutions on hybrid cloud environments.?  Automate the deployment,monitoring,and scaling of AI models in production.?  Develop and implement CI/CD pipelines for MLOps processes.?  Monitor and troubleshoot operational issues with AI models.?  Collaborate with data scientists and software engineers to ensure model performance and integration with existing systems.?  Stay up to date on the latest MLOps tools and technologies.?  Participate in research and development of new MLOps practices for hybrid environments.? To ensure youre set up for success, you will bring the following skillset & experience:  You have experience in AI and NLP techniques with expertise in deep learning and natural language processing.?  You have 3+ years of experience working in a Data Science/Machine Learning Engineering rolein MLOps or DevOps.?  You have the Ability to design and implement cloud solutions and ability to build MLOps pipelines on cloud solutions (OCP, AWS, MS Azure or GCP)?  You have experience with MLOps Frameworks like Kubeflow, MLFlow, DataRobot, Airflow etc., experience with Docker and Kubernetes, OpenShift?  You have experience with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker) and orchestration tools (e.g., Kubernetes).?  You have experience in Programming languages like Python, Go, Ruby or Bash, good understanding of Linux, knowledge of frameworks such as scikit-learn, Keras, PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.?  You have Ability to understand tools used by data scientist and experience with software development and test automation.?  You can Execute AI models and algorithms in the production scenario to elevate scalability and performance.?  You have Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, OCP, GCP, or Azure.?  You have experience with version control systems such as Git.? Whilst these are nice to have, our team can help you develop in the following skills:  CI/CD (Jenkins) environment with popular DevOps tools  Experience with Agile methodology, use of Atlassian products Jira, Confluence )  You are familiar and can take advantage of advanced IDEs such as IntelliJ, Eclipse or VSCode . Our commitment to you!? BMCs culture is built around its people. We have 6000+ brilliant minds working together across the globe. You wont be known just by your employee number, but for your true authentic self. BMC lets you be YOU!? If after reading the above, You??e unsure if you meet the qualifications of this role but are deeply excited about BMC and this team, we still encourage you to apply! We want to attract talents from diverse backgrounds and experience to ensure we face the world together with the best ideas!? BMC is committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, age, sex, creed, color, religion, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender, ?gender expression, ?gender identity, national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy, disabled veteran or status as a protected veteran. ?If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, visit the accommodation request page. column2: As a rapidly expanding global company, growing both organically and through acquisitions, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to be a part of the Quote-to-Cash (Q2C) Performance Analytics & Strategy (PAS) team      Q2C PAS team is within the Revenue Growth & Automation (RGA) org which is the global business process owner for Salesforce for end-to-end Quote-to-Cash processes      The RGA mission is to drive best-in-class end-to-end Q2C performance, improving the experience of our sellers, operators and customers through transformation      You will be given the opportunity and empowered to influence using the power of data and analytics       As a Senior Analyst - Data Engineering, you will play a pivotal role in designing, constructing, and maintaining the ETL/ELT components      Your focus will be on building scalable data pipelines, ensuring data quality, and supporting data-driven decision-making within the organization      You will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy, reliability, and consistency of data across the Q2C organization      Your role involves designing and implementing data quality processes, conducting assessments, and collaborating with various teams to establish and maintain high data quality standards          Role Description:              Table Stakes:    Build systems that collect, manage, and transform raw data into usable information for data scientists and business analysts to interpret. Wrangling large data sets using SQL, Python to identify, quantify and monitor risks in multiple processes across the company.            Own your coverage:    Take ownership of design and development of complex data pipelines, integrations, database objects and solutions that align with business objectives. Ensure data quality, integrity, security, and scalability.    Drive multiple/cross-function data source integration and modeling strategies to enable seamless metrics development experience for BI teams and to ultimately enable data-driven decision-making for our stakeholders.            Be an example:    Provide strong technical expertise within the data engineering team. Collaborate with other data engineers, business analysts on solutioning data requests.            CI/CD:    Champion engineering best practices, automate processes, and contribute to activities that streamline operations and enhance overall reliability of our data sets. Actively seek opportunities for innovation in data engineering processes and solutions in pursuit of business value.            Get predictive:    Proactively looks for opportunities to apply data science models to find/prove business value            Data migration, Documentation:    Our tech stack is evolving, as we are ever adapting. Therefore, at some point, you can expect migration, validation & testing from one system to another. This work is admittedly less exciting, but it is a value and critical to drive scale.                Desired Skills and Experience:            4+ years of experience in data engineering and/or related roles. Passion and love for solving business problems using data.          bachelors degree in Computer science or equivalent alternative education, skills, and/or practical equivalent experience.          Proficiency in common analytical programming languages (eg Python or R) and SQL, ETL/ELT tools/techniques, advanced data modeling techniques.          Fair understanding of end-to-end data development, including data model design, quality review, deployment, audits and maintenance.          Familiar with basics of statistics and machine learning methods. Curiosity in doing POCs/POVs using data science techniques/models to find/prove business value.          Stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in data engineering field(tools and techniques) and curious to find potential areas to apply them to find/prove business value. Data Analysis   : Analyze complex data sets to identify trends, anomalies, and insights relevant to PMM and DF processes. Utilize data visualization techniques to communicate findings effectively. Must be proficient in SQL queries. column2: Overview:  We are seeking a  Senior Zoho Specialist  to join our dynamic team and take charge of our  Zoho CRM  platform. Experience in administering and customizing Zoho CRM, including lead management, workflow automation, and reporting. Excellent analytical skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Effective communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to collaborate across functional teams and levels of the organization. Maintain, optimize, and enhance existing Power BI global data assets to improve performance, scalability, and user experience      Lead interaction with business stakeholders, data product owners, data analysts, data engineers, data architects and data governance specialists      Resolve any roadblocks and issues that could impact timelines to deliver      Ensure quality assurance through user testing and feedback iteration      Continue to modernize data assets to improve adoption and usage      Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with subject matter experts and data product managers to understand business objectives, use cases, and key questions that are sought to be answered through the development of global data assets such as data models.          Stakeholder management:              Ensure proper requirements are provided and understood by users, following best practices and a standard format for documenting requirements.      Operate between data engineers, data analysts (or SMEs) and data product managers          Data Preparation    :        Ensure data is fit for purpose and accuracy, consistency, and compliance with data governance standards, bringing attention to data governance teams any issues. Collaborate with Data Engineering to improve data collection, integration, and storage processes.          Systems Design:          Work directly with data product managers and the Global Data Platforms team to support architecture design that effectively interfaces with BI systems and applications.          BI Systems Adoption:          Support BI adoption efforts through leadership, best practice sharing, and individual consultation across the business.          Learning and Development:          Remain current with the latest BI tools, industry trends, and emerging data analysis techniques that can further McCains analytical agenda.          Mentorship and Leadership:          Provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts. Lead by example in terms of best practices in data modeling, requirements gathering, and BI.                Educational Qualifications and Experience:            6-10 years of experience working in data-driven environments, including data modelling      Hold a bachelors or masters degree in business administration or a STEM-based program          Digital and Data Skills:         Proven expertise in designing and implementing complex data models using Power BI, or with similar tools (e.g. Microstrategy, Qlik, Tableau)      Proficient in DAX and SQL      Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS, data warehousing, and business intelligence/rules design concepts and toolsets      Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and optimize BI solutions.      Solid fundamentals in the areas of performance tuning, modern data storage architecture, data analytics and reporting tools      Experience in analyzing large and complex datasets (structured and unstructured), with a strong aptitude for conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis      Develop advanced dashboards using Power BI, demonstrating data visualization and business intelligence (BI) best practices      Understanding of data governance principles and requirements gathering best practices          Nice to have:    Experience of Azure Data Platform        Nice to have:    Working knowledge of another programming language (Python, R)        Data Literacy and Communication:         Solid understanding of how data systems are designed and ability to work with data engineers and data architects      Ability to translate non-technical business requirements into technical / BI solutions      Strong ability to actively listen and understand the needs of business users/customers and work with functional groups      Excellent facilitator, well organized with highly effective written and verbal communication skills      Strong business partnering: ability to engage, interact, influence, and be a trusted and credible internal adviser

column2: The data and geospatial analyst will develop map products, reports and/or dashboard applying data and spatial analysis techniques to multiple humanitarian aid, international development and other projects underway at Catholic Relief Services (CRS)     These products serve as valuable communication tools to improve the efficacy of programs     Examples of similar work at CRS include: analysis of malaria knowledge, attitudes and practices to answer questions about where malaria education campaigns would have the greatest impact; and predictive analysis of walking paths to optimize placement of food distribution sites              Responsibilities:       o Build capacity in our team to: run advanced analytics processes including machine learning. automating analytics processes, database architecture, and simplifying processes.   o Review, test and implement system changes to formulas and sheets.    o Customer service: identify ways we can build efficiencies and automate or offload processes in data or system issues.   o Work autonomously and identify needs as they arise, be able to prioritize workflow and identify ways to automate or delegate repetitive tasks       Visualization       o Evaluate publicly available data sources and their fitness for use.   o Evaluate data that will be collected via mobile devices and identify the best approach to visualize it using ArcGIS suite of tools and/or PowerBI.   o Improve the visualization of advanced analytics so that data visuals are easy to interpret and are in line with CRS data visual branding standards.       Spatial Analysis       o Utilize machine learning in spatial analysis workflows and satellite imagery analysis.   o Build the teams capacity on spatial analysis, including; object-oriented classification, remote sensing, interpolation, and prediction, with the possibility of 3D modeling.    o Create automatic workflows to replicate spatial analysis.   o Promote the workflows in easily accessible language in webinars, newsletters, and one pagers.       ?Enterprise GIS       o Champion the opportunities that GIS offers to CRS and contribute to the evolution and implementation of the agencys GIS roadmap.   o Incorporate geospatial technology into enterprise systems (examples include SalesForce and ERP) and define common processes for GIS implementation efforts.   o Lead GIS system definition efforts including elicitation of business needs, definition of potential solutions to meeting those needs and incorporation of GIS into proposals.   o Proactively identify areas for capacity development, develop and curate advanced GIS training curricula/content and deliver trainings both onsite and remotely.   o Assess and remain current about emerging trends in the use of spatial data in the relief and development sector.        Data Analytics       o Coordinate/lead research engagements with external organizations to create new analytics processes that can be scaled to new country programs.    o Coordinate an external analytics support group to bolster CRS analytics ability   o Attend meetings with external advisors in data analytics   o Coach team members in their external research engagements, assuring clarified expectations and a positive experience for both parties.   o Provide consultancy to field projects on best use of data analytics and visualization.   o Ensure deployment of   o Integration interface between standard forms and legacy data   o Data Warehouse (wherever applicable)   o Reports and Dashboards   o Enable smarter business processes-and implement analytics for meaningful insights.   o Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive projects.   o Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.   o Promote and contribute to the data security approach throughout the support process.   o Help build a culture of data use and decision making       Qualifications:   Education / Certifications       o Masters degree in data science, Geographic Information Systems related field or equivalent experience.    o Certified Analytics Professional (CAP), or Data Science Council of America (DASCA) Principle Data Scientist (PDS) or higher, or Open Certified Data Scientist (Open CDS) preferred.   o Esri ArcGIS Desktop Certification (10.1 or higher; Associate or Professional level)   o Experience with UML 2.0 highly preferred.    o ITIL Foundation Certification desired.   o Ability to code in R and Python preferred.       General Experience       o Experience delivering training on data analysis to both technical and non-technical audiences; both in person and remotely.    o Experience developing work plans (project plans) that address all phases of solution delivery and managing project risk and dependencies.    o Good understanding of business analysis and business process mapping (using industry standards); ability to capture as-is and to-be business models.?    o Experience with vendor selection and management including developing RFPs, SOWs and managing/monitoring vendor work activities       Technologies       o Data analysis software   o Experience using ArcGIS Online strongly preferred; experience using ArcGIS Pro and Collector for ArcGIS desired   o Demonstrable experience applying core concepts of cartography to quality map production   o Demonstrable experience applying spatial analysis to solve real-world problems    o Strong understanding of relational databases (SQL Server strongly preferred), data modeling and general geodata management technologies.    o Ability to code in python, and R preferred       Personal/Professional Qualities:       o Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences, including briefings with agency leadership.   o Ability to represent the agency in external forums.    o Excellent interpersonal, presentation and oral and written communication skills.   o Ability to thrive as part of a geographically distributed team.   o Ability to work independently and be self-driven.   o Highly responsive with an attitude of service.   o Attention to detail and organized.        Travel:     o This position will require 10-20% international travel, including to resource poor locations.?        Supervisory Responsibilities:     o Supervise TDY and intern staff as needed.       Language Required:     o Must be fluent in written and spoken English; French or Spanish fluency desirable.       QUALIFICATIONS   Basic Qualifications   ?        Bachelors degree in Cyber or IT related field or equivalent experience     Minimum of 5 years experience in Information Security administration     Experience with Microsoft Windows operating systems, Office 365,     Enterprise Mobility and Security (EMS) and Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM)     Experience with Privilege Access Management solutions, Least privilege Access Management platforms and multi-factor authentication solutions among other technologies     Experience in managing Information Security compliance     In depth knowledge of Information risk concepts / relating business needs to security controls   ?         Agency-wide Competencies (for all CRS Staff)        These are rooted in the mission, values, and guiding principles of CRS and used by each staff member to fulfill his or her responsibilities and achieve the desired results.       Integrity     Continuous Improvement & Innovation     Builds Relationships     Develops Talent     Strategic Mindset     Accountability & Stewardship

column2: Lead      the design and development of scalable and efficient data architecture      solutions that align with business objectives and industry best practices. Design      and implement data models, schemas, and structures to support various data      processing and analysis requirements. Architect      and implement data integration solutions to streamline data flows across      heterogeneous systems and platforms. Establish      and enforce data governance policies, standards, and procedures to ensure      data quality, integrity, and security. Identify      and implement performance optimization techniques to enhance the      efficiency and speed of data processing and retrieval. Implement      robust data security measures to safeguard sensitive information and      ensure compliance with regulatory requirements. Collaborate      with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, analysts, and      business stakeholders, to understand requirements and deliver optimal data      solutions. Database      Technologies:  Extensive experience with      database technologies such as Snowflake, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Azure      SQL, SQL Server, Synapse, HDFS, Hive, and HBase (NoSQL). Data      Processing Tools:  Proficiency in data processing      tools and frameworks, including Kafka, Kafka Streams, Azure Data factory,      Azure Data Bricks, Power BI, and Tableau. Data      Modeling Tools:  Familiarity with data modeling      tools such as Erwin, MS Visio for designing and managing data models. Programming      Languages:  Strong programming skills in      languages such as Python, Pyspark, Psql, and Bash for data manipulation,      scripting, and automation. Cloud      Platforms:  Hands-on experience with cloud      platforms, particularly Azure, including Azure Data Catalog for metadata      management. Data      Analysis Techniques:  Knowledge      of advanced data analysis techniques and algorithms, including Random      Forest Algorithm, Lewandowski, and Holt Winters for predictive modeling      and forecasting. Communication      and Collaboration:  Excellent      communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively      communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and      collaborate with cross-functional teams. Can join immediately. Please share CVs at ankit.kumar@celsiortech.com

column2: Organizational Overview:  Our Analytics organization comprises of data analysts who focus on enabling strategies to enhance customer and partner experience and optimize business performance through data management and development of full stack descriptive to prescriptive analytics solutions using cutting edge technologies thereby enabling business growth  Role Summary/Purpose:  VP, Sams Club Analytics role is a part of India Analytics Hub (IAH). The role involves leading an analytics team and developing analytic capabilities and solutions in partnership with US Analytics teams across marketing planning, measurement and optimization, customer analytics, targeting & segmentation, forecasting, etc. areas to identify growth opportunities , optimize business strategies and derive actionable insights across customer journey.  Key Responsibilities:   Provide leadership and hands-on analytic support to the Sams Club Card Program as and when required   Co-own development of analytic agenda and roadmap with US counterpart and deliver on portfolio goals   Be a hands on leader and willing to roll up sleeves to lead projects , perform data analysis   Drive insightful business reviews to provide diagnostics and performance drivers   Spearhead analytics delivery for new product launches, value propositions, customer acquisitions, lifecycle b marketing and customer experience initiatives  Lead the analytics team to design, develop, implement and monitor analytic solutions catering to business priorities and propose new analytic solutions to optimize business value and customer experience   Lead strategic/complex analytics projects from beginning to end, including ideation, data mining, strategy formulation, and presentation of results and recommendations   Create test and learn culture through ongoing assessment of marketing programs/campaigns   Together with US analytics teams, foster strong partnership and engagement with both the internal Synchrony business and client teams   Effectively engage to partner with internal business teams at all levels, including senior leadership team   Partner with portfolio teams to build business cases and plans to drive marketing and customer strategy, incl. targeting, testing designing, opportunities and cost/benefit analysis to review with client and business teams   Participate in and present at business and client leadership meetings representing team and analytics org   Influence business strategies and decisions leveraging analytic insights   Manage, coach and develop a team of analytics professionals dedicated to Sams Analytics Team Prioritize workflow across teams to ensure highest-quality execution and delivery across all areas of analytics   Lead and inspire a team of professionals, providing mentorship, guidance, engagement, career pathing and development opportunities   Formulate strategy and action plan to recruit, retain and develop analytic talent   Coach and develop analytic professional through training and hands-on experiences   Partner with Analytics CoE teams to drive best practices and centralized analytic capabilities across clients   Develop & apply advanced analytics to optimize business outcomes   Partner with Digital and Journey Analytics teams to develop and implement analytic solutions to improve customer experience across different channels   Provide input to CoE teams representing client and business  Proactively manage all analytic projects with weekly update on timeline, status, and resource allocation; Ensure delivery of all BAU and strategic projects based on business demand and requirements   Drive internal initiatives, perform other duties and/or special projects, as assigned  Required Skills/Knowledge:  Minimum 8 years of experience in building analytics to drive strategy with positive outcomes and measuring impact   Minimum 6 years of experience in managing people, developing talent, providing & receiving constructive feedback   Minimum 6 years of hands-on SQL and SAS programming experience with an ability to leverage advanced algorithms and be efficient in handling complex/large data sets   Good working knowledge of statistical tests, distributions, regression, maximum likelihood estimators, etc.   Advanced proficiency in MS-Excel and MS-PowerPoint with superior data analyses and story boarding skills   Ability to build and lead large teams, articulate a clear vision and deliver measurable results   Ability to work in matrix organization, make and enable data driven decisions   Demonstrated ability to manage complexity/ambiguity and multiple initiatives  Desired Skills/Knowledge:  Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to engage effectively with a broad range of audiences including senior business leaders, other senior analytics leaders, and highly technical talent   Proven hands-on experience utilizing SAS and SQL; Experience with open-source tools such as R and Python a plus; Experience with Tableau a plus   Ability to influence business strategies and decisions based on analytic insight   Ability to foster partnership and/or influence senior corporate decision makers   Experience with modeling/forecasting, and strong understanding of targeting and segmentation   Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau   Ability to ideate, design and lead development of analytic capabilities and solutions   Good understanding of credit card industry financial P&L drivers and key sensitivities  Eligibility Criteria:  Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, or any other quantitative streams with 10+ years of relevant analytics experience. Minimum 12+ years of relevant work experience in lieu of specified degree.  Work Timings: This role qualifies for Enhanced Flexibility and Choice offered in Synchrony India and will require the incumbent to be available between 06:00 AM Eastern Time  11:30 AM Eastern Time (timings are anchored to US Eastern hours and will adjust twice a year locally). This window is for meetings with India and US teams. The remaining hours will be flexible for the employee to choose. Exceptions may apply periodically due to business needs. Please discuss this with the hiring manager for more details. The position is remote, where you have the option to work from home.
column11: SAS, Tableau, SQL, Python, R, SAS Programming, Analytics

column2: Responsible for a variety of tasks relating to the flawless output of data for all surveys run by the business and teams globally. The Data Processing Specialist will enhance and assist with the Quality Assurance processes run by teams and will expertly utilize tools such as SPSS and Q to ensure the datafile is presented to the client free of errors, in an optimized fashion and in their desired format. They will also step in where required to resolve any data queries internal or external stakeholders may have.                 ROLE ACCOUNTABILITIES & COMPETENCIES               Assisting in reviewing scripting logic present in questionnaires to ensure syntaxes can be written ahead of time to validate survey responses.             Flagging queries with Survey Programmers or wider project teams where scripting logic may not make sense and providing suggestions on how they should be adjusted to ensure better data quality.             Ensuring data is correctly delivered in the client s desired format without errors and provides an extra layer of checking where required.             Providing clear and accurate ETAs on data processing tasks to ensure deadlines are met.              Ability to generate table outputs or data in client required format.             Ability to understand SPSS and Q to control quality assurances, provide guidance internally or externally and facilitate customized requests.             Full understanding of raw data, what it is, how to read and comprehend it and produce operational procedures to better business practices where possible.             High level of ownership in day-to-day work, including the ability to admit where errors have occurred, take steps to resolve those errors, minimize risk of recurrence, and to escalate where necessary to managers.                   ABOUT YOU:         Here are the other skills you will need to be successful in this role:               3 to 5 years of experience in Data Processing role or equivalent which includes data checks through SPSS.             High level of skill using tools such as SPSS, Q and Excel             Proven ability to communicate clearly, effectively and in a timely manner with internal and external stakeholders.             Keen eye for detail and ability to run meticulous and thorough quality checks on own work.             Ability to prioritize the tasks and manage time effectively.

column2: Role: Data Analyst LINC Education is seeking young and talented professionals for a full-time position, to assist our operations team with reporting, analytics, and data management activities. LINC takes an extremely data-driven approach to managing our team of LINC Fellows (academic professionals) using several technology tools. This is a unique opportunity to become a part of a fast-growing professional education company that is developing a truly differentiated solution for delivering high-quality online education to students around the world.  The Data Analyst will work with the Program Operations team to provide data management and analytics support. The role will cover the following key areas  Coordinate with the Program Manager to manage the LINC database and execute related daily activities Analysis and report generation for University clients / internal purposes Streamlining data capture mechanism using our Business Intelligence tools (Google Data Studio, Tableau) Work with the Operations team for any other data management and analysis tasks The Data Analyst will report directly to the Manager - Program Operations. What are we looking for? Qualification and Experience: The ideal candidate should have an undergraduate degree from a Tier-I Engineering College (or a comparable degree in a quantitative field). The candidate must have 1-3 years of professional experience (EdTech/Operations background preferred). Analytical Capability: The candidate must be sharp with numbers and willing to get their hands dirty with data and analysis. They must have experience and advanced-level proficiency working with Google Sheets / MS Excel and Looker Studio / Tableau. Entrepreneurial: In a startup environment, you need to be resourceful, creative and ready to handle the unknown. It is important that you can work in a fast-paced environment, think on your feet and go beyond your immediate scope of work. Driven: An ambition to significantly enhance your skills and experiences while creating a new way of delivering quality education to global audiences. 5.Location: Vikhroli, Mumbai Next Steps: Interested applicants should send their resumes specifying their work experience, education qualifications (including grade achieved), achievements and a cover letter to recruitment@linceducation.com with the subject Application for Data Analyst.

column2: Lead Analyst   Who we are: Vista's Engineering organization is working to make our company one of the world's most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes analysts, software and data engineers, architects, data scientists, product owners, and more - all passionate about providing Vista with solutions, insights and tools to develop products and services customer love. Vista Engineering team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers. We work in close collaboration with our partners in the business, Customer Service, Product Development, and Marketing as we embark on an exciting journey to upgrade our customer service with advanced analytics. Vista is a leader in custom designs and professional marketing for small businesses and offers phenomenal customer service. Our goal is to empower our teams with innovative data analytics solutions and actionable insights, enabling them to deliver an exceptional customer experience and drive continuous improvement. What You Will Do: Be a central part of our mission to become the expert design and marketing partner for small businesses  by helping teams across Vista to understand their impact on customer experience and how they can become more customer-centric. As an analytics partner, be an integral part of the CARE Product Development team  that creates innovative solutions to create excellent support and a world-class experience for our customers, specialists, and designers, including AI/GenAI-driven solutions. Explore, analyze and model data  from various contact center data sources to create holistic reporting of the performance, drivers, and trends of Contact Center Operations and to understand the impact of improvement drivers for customer experience and efficiency as well as to identify improvement opportunities for the Product teams. Deliver data insights in actionable, informative and visually exciting user interfaces,  enabling stakeholders to understand current performance and trends, key drivers of experience as well as prioritized areas for action. Design, give advice on, and execute a/b/n tests  to optimize the customer experience, analyze results to provide insightful recommendations to the business, and build self-service experimentation capabilities for the Product team. Coach more junior analysts  and guide their work to deliver best-in-class analytics for stakeholders. Collaborate with CARE, analytics, engineering, and other business colleagues from all over the world  who understand the value of a truly diverse and cross-functional workplace. At Vista, your voice and expertise are heard! Collaborate in a fast paced, agile environment  at focuses on delivering customer value early and often. Your Qualifications: Passionate  about data and technology.  Proficient in SQL and in creating great self-service dashboards, e.g., in Tableau or Looker.  Other programming languages/analytics platforms (e.g., Python, R, Google Analytics) and experience with hypothesis testing is a strong plus. A resourceful and pro-active problem solver.  Strong analytical thinking, excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail, an ability to effectively deliver on projects and support multiple business partners as well as a drive to pro-actively see, follow-up, and resolve analytical problems. Have a growth mindset  A continuous self-learner by nature. Sees challenges as an opportunity to grow. Thinks setbacks and mistakes are valuable learning moments; effort and feedback are essential tools to grow. Customer focused and partnering with stakeholders.  Ability to not just think about improving the end customer experience, but also to build intuitive analytics tools by partnering closely with the internal user  advising and educating them on data-related topics and help the team to develop and follow a data-driven approach to Product Development. Inquisitive by nature.  Comfortable with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques and able to find meaningful patterns and trends in the data; ability to tackle complex problems, drawing inferences from data, and create     workable solutions based on business rules. Experienced . Minimum 7 years of experience in analytics, preferably in eCommerce environment. Bachelors degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science,      Engineering, Economics or related field from a top-notch university. Experience in tech startups or management consulting and in Experimentation is a plus. Why Youll Love Working Here: We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed and take a step forward in your learning journey  and your life. Through constant learning, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to whats next, were always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. At Vista, we put great importance into the wellbeing of our employees, which is why we offer perks that ensure an excellent work/life balance. Perks include flexible schedules, work from home capabilities, and very generous time off, including our outstanding sabbatical-like program, Vistabreak, to name a few! About Us: As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vista is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane as chairman and Florian Baumgartner as CEO, weve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses to successfully market and grow their business. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth  for both our customers and our team. user  Equal Opportunity Employer: Vista, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.
column11: Hypothesis Testing, Regression, Data Visualization, Statistical Techniques, SQL, GenAI, Exploratory Data Analysis, Google Analytics, Ab Testing, Adobe Analytics

column2: About RP-Sanjiv Goenka Group: The RP-Sanjiv Goenka Group is a diversified conglomerate with interests across Energy (Power, Renewables, Chemicals), Consumer (retail, food services), Entertainment (media, music, sports) and technology businesses. The group overall has 15+ companies, 45,000+ employees with gross assets close to INR 40,355 Cr. The group has been growing at more than 20% p.a. for the last 5 years, and wishes to embark on an even more aggressive growth trajectory over the next 5-10 year horizon. The flagship companies include: CESC Limited A Fully Integrated Private Power Utility Spencers Retail Indias second largest food based retailer Firstsource Solutions  India?? Top 3 pure play BPO player Saregama India ??the biggest collection of Indian music Phillips Carbon Black - India?? 2nd largest carbon black manufacturer Harrisons Malayalam ??One of the largest plantation businesses in India Along with Spencer?? Retail and Saregama, the Group has also ventured into FMCG business recently through Guiltfree Industries Limited. It has also acquired another FMCG Company, Apricot Foods Private Limited.With strong profitability, robust balance sheets and deep cash reserves, the Group is looking to build a strong position in the consumer goods and retail space. As a group, RP-SG is committed to invest $3 Billion + additional capital over the next 4-5 years, primarily into the consumer and technology business Background ??FMCG Business RPSG FMCG Business has made strong initial inroads by creating a new segment of snacks in the Indian market, with its brand ??oo Yumm??In a short period the brand has established itself across India as a strong choice vis a vis of traditional fried. This was possible by bold investments in product design and go to market. The division also has forayed into traditional snacks and Ayurveda ( Dr Vaidya??). The group is now in earnest to build the FMCG business in India through bold organic growth and acquisitions. Background ??Herbolab India Pvt Ltd. Dr Vaidya?? is a new age Ayurvedic company that strives to bring the traditional, time-tested goodness of Ayurveda to 21st-century customers. Founded by the Vaidya family, whose expertise spans 150 years of Ayurvedic heritage, their formulations and knowledge for Ayurvedic Products have been passed down from generation to generation through dedicated practice. Today, the company owns 100+ FDA approved, proprietary formulations for Ayurvedic medicine. Products sold online (owned channel i.e. drvaidyas.com and third party channels i.e. Amazon, Nykaa, Netmeds, Medlife, Pharmeasy etc.) as well as >500 offline stores (including Noble Plus, Twenty Four Seven etc.). Learn more on www.drvaidyas.com and www. rpsg.in Educational Qualification , Work experience & Key CompetenciesQualification Bachelor?? or master?? degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science). Work Experience: Key Competencies Proven experience of minimum 3 years as a Data Analyst or similar role. Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, etc. Strong understanding of statistical analysis and data visualization techniques. Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). Solid knowledge of database management systems (SQL, NoSQL). Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines. Attention to detail and a passion for data accuracy. Experience with machine learning and predictive analytics is a plus. JOB DESCRIPTION Purpose: As a Senior Data Analyst at Dr Vaidya, you will play a critical role in transforming raw data into actionable insights. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze data, develop reports, and provide strategic recommendations that will drive business growth and enhance our competitive edge. Responsibilities: Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, anomalies, and insights that can inform strategic decisions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data analysis tasks. Perform complex data analysis tasks, including data cleansing, aggregation, and visualization. Develop and maintain advanced data models and analytical tools. Create and automate reports and dashboards for key stakeholders. Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis. Collaborate with IT teams to optimize data storage and retrieval processes. Create and maintain reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs). Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide data-driven insights. Design and execute A/B tests to evaluate the effectiveness of business strategies. Develop predictive and prescriptive models to support decision-making. Mentor and provide guidance to junior analysts. Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis.

column2: Mission: Through our network of brands, Newfold Digital provides everything businesses need to succeed online. From domains and web hosting to web design and online marketing tools, our helpful business-building services and smart solutions give our customers an edge on the competition. What you'll do & how youll make your mark: Publish and maintain a standard set of website performance dashboards and scorecard reports. Provide insight into site visitor behavior and engagement in order to identify optimization opportunities and inform site design changes, as well as help to prioritize these opportunities based on value, potential, effort and resources. Assist in the analysis and reporting for A/B testing focused on conversion rate optimization. Coordinate with technical teams to ensure accurate and comprehensive web analytics implementation and track across acquisition channels. Proactively monitor customer behavior on our websites to detect potential issues and subsequently assist with determining root causes and resolving the error. Identify opportunities to continually optimize web page performance. Who you are & what youll need to succeed. 4+ years corporate experience in Marketing Analytics, Business Analytics or a related field, including the development of analytics dashboards, solutions and strategies across digital marketing platforms and ecosystems. Background supporting E-Commerce site/corporation strongly preferred. Must have expertise using one or more leading web analytics and optimization tools (Adobe/Omniture/Site Catalyst, Google Analytics 360, Adobe Test & Target, Optimizely, etc.) Strong experience with Microsoft Excel or similar (e.g., Tableau) for data manipulation and visualization is required. Experience with experimental design and/or statistical analysis to drive business decision-making. A deep understanding of prospective customer behavior, fundamentals of sales and marketing psychology, ROI and analytics, and design and testing methodologies Strong in statistical concepts and data science methodologies Experience working with large and complex SQL databases. Experience with digital marketing channel analysis (PPC, SEO, Display, Social) Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, Economics, Statistics, MIS, Mathematics, Business, or other quantitative discipline or equivalent Desire to work collaboratively in a team-based environment is a must, and a sense of humor is always appreciated. Our work is thrilling and meaningful, but we know the right balance is key to living well We celebrate one another?? differences . We??e proud of our culture of diversity and inclusion. We foster a culture of belonging. Our company and customers benefit when employees bring their authentic selves to work. We have programs that bring us together on important issues and we provide learning and development opportunities for all employees. We have 20 + affinity groups where you can network and connect with Newfolders globally. We care about you.  At Newfold, taking care of our employees is our top priority. Depending on what country you live in, we make sure that the right benefits are in place for you. We have partnered with some of the best insurance providers to provide you excellent Health Insurance options, Education/ Certification Sponsorships to give you a chance to further your knowledge, Flexi-leaves to take personal time off and much more! Analyze sales trends, market dynamics, and performance metrics to identify patterns, opportunities, and areas for improvement. Develop and generate regular and ad-hoc analytical reports, dashboards, and presentations for internal stakeholders, including sales teams, marketing departments, and senior management. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to sales activities, such as revenue, market share, product penetration, and customer segmentation. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop sales forecasts, budgets, and targets based on historical data and market insights. Implement automation tools and technologies to optimize repetitive tasks and improve data-driven decision-making capabilities. Work closely with sales, marketing, finance, and operations teams to understand business requirements and align analytical initiatives with organizational goals. Provide analytical support and insights to facilitate strategic planning, campaign management, and resource allocation decisions. Qualifications & Requirement: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management Information Systems (MIS), Statistics, Economics, or a related field. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and extract actionable insights. Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or similar software. Familiarity with Software systems (e.g., Salesforce) and database management principles. Excellent communication skills with the ability to present findings and recommendations effectively to diverse audiences. Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to data accuracy and quality assurance. Proactive problem-solving attitude with a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

Share and collaborate effectively with others.      Identify and make suggestions for improvements when problems and/or opportunities arise.      Handle, manipulate and analyse data and information responsibly.      Follow risk management and compliance procedures.      Keep up-to-date with developments in area of specialism.      Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner - verbally and in the materials I produce.      Build and maintain an internal and external network.      Seek opportunities to learn about how PwC works as a global network of firms.      Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                                GenAI Data Scientist - Associate                      PwC US - Acceleration Center is seeking an emerging GenAI Data Scientist to join our team at the Associate level        This role provides an exciting opportunity to contribute to developing and implementing machine learning models and algorithms for our GenAI projects      The ideal candidate should have foundational knowledge in data science, with an interest in GenAI technologies, and possess an understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, data visualization, and basic application programmin               Responsibilities:                  Assist cross-functional teams in gathering business requirements and identifying opportunities for applying GenAI technologies.                  Support the development and implementation of machine learning models and algorithms under the guidance of senior data scientists.                  Participate in data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering to prepare data for analysis.                  Work closely with data engineers to facilitate efficient data processing and integration into machine learning pipelines.                  Help validate and evaluate model performance using standard metrics and techniques.                  Contribute to the development and deployment of machine learning applications and solutions.                  Utilize basic object-oriented programming skills to assist in building software components.                  Gain experience with Kubernetes for container orchestration and deployment.                  Assist in designing and building chatbots using GenAI technologies.                  Help communicate findings and insights to stakeholders through basic data visualizations and reports.                  Keep abreast of the latest advancements in GenAI technologies and contribute to discussions on innovative solutions to enhance data science processes.                  Requirements:                  Bachelors degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.                  1-3 years of relevant experience, ideally with exposure to GenAI projects.                  Proficient programming skills in Python, R, or Scala.                  Familiarity with machine learning libraries and frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.                  Basic experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and data wrangling techniques.                  Understanding of statistical analysis and experimental design.                  Awareness of cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.                  Some knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques.                  Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.                  Good communication and teamwork abilities.                  Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.                  Preferred Qualifications:                  Some experience with object-oriented programming languages such as Java, C++, or C#.                  Exposure to developing or assisting in the deployment of machine learning applications.                  Basic understanding of data privacy and compliance issues.                  Nice to Have Skills:                  Exposure to Azure AI Search, Azure Doc Intelligence, Azure OpenAI, AWS Textract, AWS Open Search, AWS Bedrock.                  Familiarity with LLM backed agent frameworks like Autogen, Langchain, Semantic Kernel.                  Interest in chatbot design and development.

column2: Organizational Overview:  Our Analytics team comprises of data analysts who focus on improving customer/product/digital/ journey experience etc. and growth by providing full stack descriptive to prescriptive analytics via cutting edge technologies to support business objectives Role Summary/Purpose:  Sr. Analyst, Analytics (individual contributor) role is a part of Home & Auto & Digital pillar under India Analytics Hub (IAH). The role will include understanding the request of the business, Extract , transform , validate and visualize large data to address project delivery enabling Synchronys growth and profitability. The model candidate must be passionate about data & analytics, know the story and keen on learning new technologies. You will have the opportunity to work with a specific portfolio or cross-functional teams and leverage state of the art tools (viz., SAS, Model buildersuite of products, R, Python etc.,). This position is remote, where you have the option to work from home.  Key Responsibilities:  Leverage Data and Analytical tools to create and track metrics which reflect state of the business  Triangulate and analyze data from multiple sources to draw insights and make recommendations to fulfil business/project objectives  Adherence to timely delivery, accuracy and documentation in line with Audit Procedures  Required Skills/Knowledge:  Academic knowledge of SQL / SAS /Open Source concepts, ability to write and execute queries.  Basic Understanding of Core Concepts / Metrics in Retail Finance.  Ability to articulate analysis outcomes into findings and recommendations.  Excellent Written and Verbal communication skills.  Desired Skills/Knowledge:  Working Knowledge on SQL/SAS/Python to perform data manipulation Eligibility Criteria:  Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or another quantitative field with 0 to 2 years experience or in lieu of a degree, a high school certificate and additional 2 years of work experience. Work Timings:  This role qualifies for Enhanced Flexibility and Choice offered in Synchrony India and will require the incumbent to be available between 06:00 AM Eastern Time  11:30 AM Eastern Time (timings are anchored to US Eastern hours and will adjust twice a year locally). This window is for meetings with India and US teams. The remaining hours will be flexible for the employee to choose. Exceptions may apply periodically due to business needs. Please discuss this with the hiring manager for more details.

column2: Entity :- Accenture Strategy & Consulting Team :- Global Network Data & AI Practice :- Life Sciences  Title :- Ind & Func AI Decision Science Consultant Job Location :- Delhi, Gurgaon, Mumbai, Bangalore About Strategy & Consulting Global Network :- Accenture S&C Global Network - Data & AI practice help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Analytics enables our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships. From strategy to execution, Accenture works with organizations to develop analytic capabilities - from accessing and reporting on data to predictive modelling - to outperform the competition. WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? An opportunity to work on high-visibility projects with top Pharma clients around the globe.  Potential to Co-create with leaders in strategy, industry experts, enterprise function practitioners, and business intelligence professionals to shape and recommend innovative solutions that leverage emerging technologies. Ability to embed responsible business into everythingfrom how you service your clients to how you operate as a responsible professional.  Personalized training modules to develop your strategy & consulting acumen to grow your skills, industry knowledge, and capabilities.  Opportunity to thrive in a culture that is committed to accelerating equality for all. Engage in boundaryless collaboration across the entire organization. What you would do in this role Support delivery of small to medium-sized teams to deliver consulting projects for global clients.  Responsibilities may include strategy, implementation, process design, and change management for specific modules.  Work with the team or as an Individual contributor on the project assigned which includes a variety of skills to be utilized from Data Engineering to Data Science Develop assets and methodologies, point-of-view, research, or white papers for use by the team and the larger community. Work on variety of projects in Data Modeling, Data Engineering, Data Visualization, Data Science etc., Acquire new skills that have utility across industry groups. Support strategies and operating models focused on some business units and assess likely competitive responses. Also, assess implementation readiness and points of greatest impact. Make presentations wherever required to a known audience or client on functional aspects of his or her domain. Qualification Who are we looking for? Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, or other Quantitative field. Proven experience (2+ years) in working on Life Sciences/Pharma/Healthcare projects and delivering successful outcomes. Understanding of Pharma data sets commercial, clinical, RWE (Real World Evidence) & EMR (Electronic medical records)  Leverage one's hands on experience of working across one or more of these areas such as real-world evidence data, R&D clinical data, digital marketing data. Hands-on experience in building and deployment of Statistical Models/Machine Learning including Segmentation & predictive modeling, hypothesis testing, multivariate statistical analysis, time series techniques, and optimization. Hands-on experience with handling Datasets like Komodo, RAVE, IQVIA, Truven, Optum etc. Proficiency in Programming languages such as R, Python, SQL, Spark, etc. Ability to work with large data sets and present findings/insights to key stakeholders; Data management using databases like SQL. Experience with any of the cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for deploying and scaling language models. Experience with any of the Data Visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, Qlikview, Spotfire is good to have. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven mindset. Proficient in Excel, MS Word, PowerPoint, etc. Ability to solve complex business problems and deliver client delight. Strong writing skills to build points of view on current industry trends. Good communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills

column2: Skill required:  Property & Casualty - Catastrophe Risk Management Designation:  Analytics and Modeling Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years  What would you do? We help insurers redefine their customer experience while accelerating their innovation agenda to drive sustainable growth by transforming to an intelligent operating model. Intelligent Insurance Operations combines our advisory, technology, and operations expertise, global scale, and robust ecosystem with our insurance transformation capabilities. It is structured to address the scope and complexity of the ever-changing insurance environment and offers a flexible operating model that can meet the unique needs of each market segment.Catastrophe Risk Management refers to the process of guiding insurers how to manage risk aggregations, deploy capital, and price insurance coverage by using computer assisted calculations to estimate the losses that could be sustained due to a catastrophic event such as a hurricane or earthquake. What are we looking for? Microsoft Excel Ability to perform under pressure Collaboration and interpersonal skills Commitment to quality Prioritization of workload Written and verbal communication Commercial Insurance Property and Casualty Insurance Insurance Risk Management  Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments The decisions that you make would impact your own work You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification BE,BTech,BCom

The individual will work closely with a team of fixed income research strategists in New York and London to help expand our analytics toolkit, analyze data sets to identify trends and patterns and apply statistical and machine learning techniques to produce cutting edge insights for Research publication.                      We offer     high impact projects with peers in New York and London. Your contributions will be visible and you will have the opportunity to gain insight into the fascinating world of banking and finance, coauthor and publish research reports, and interact with Morgan Stanley clients.                                  RESPONSIBILITIES                              Work with fixed income research strategists globally to develop and maintain data analysis infrastructures                     Acquire, clean, maintain, and analyze data sets to identify trends and patterns                     Develop quantitative models using econometrics and machine learning algorithms                     Build web applications to monitor market movements and develop interactive tools to make quantitative models user friendly                     Respond to bespoke data analysis requests from clients and internal stake holders                     Automate delivery of reports and data-packs to clients                       QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS / REQUIREMENTS                              Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as Financial Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, Physics, or Economics                     Fresh graduate or 1-4 years of experience in relevant roles                     Experience with statistical model development, modeling best practices and methodologies in the areas of data processing, sampling, model design/specification                     Hands on experience in any programing language (Python, C++, Q, Perl, JavaScript)                     Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills                     A genuine interest and understanding of financial markets                     Candidates should be analytical, insightful, quick learners, team players, multi-taskers, with a positive attitude

We help insurers redefine their customer experience while accelerating their innovation agenda to drive sustainable growth by transforming to an intelligent operating model. column1: Senior Project Associate - Data Solutions Architect
column2: You will lead the development of data and software products that improve how we create, discover, and use data to support a more resilient and prosperous world. As the Data Solutions Architect, AgriAdapt and Urban Heat you will develop and implement data product roadmaps, managing data pipelines and overseeing the release of new features. This role is a combination of hands-on and an advisory role.     You will be supported by a team of data science, software engineering and product staff within WRI s Data Lab, and subject matter experts from WRI s Climate Resilience Practice and Ross Centre for Sustainable Cities. You will report to the Program Head - Spatial Data and Data Analytics at WRI India s Sustainable Cities and Transport program.     You will be fully remote but could become hybrid depending on the available office space where you are located.       How your day will unfold:              Translate user and stakeholders needs into technical solutions (50%):         Assist the AgriAdapt and Urban Heat project teams (Cities, Data Lab, Climate Resilience Practice) in transforming insights collected from user research activities into locally relevant data solutions that meet the requirements of the stakeholders (government, universities, civil society, user community).     Facilitate architectural and design workshops with AgriAdapt and Urban Heat project teams and stakeholders to understand project goals, propose and refine technical solutions.     Identify technical challenges related to the implementation of urban heat data applications within different stakeholders contexts (integration with existing systems, data sharing and documentation, solutions architecture).     Deliver target architecture and design documents to ensure the build of new data applications and features.         Manage the delivery of technical solutions (30%):          Lead the build of the AgriAdapt global data platform built on Resource Watch API, and our future products localized to India stakeholders needs and context.     Build and demonstrate rapid prototypes and identify technical opportunities for scaling them.     Provide technical support to Project Managers in coordinating the work of all consultants and sub-contractors, ensuring and quality delivery of expected outputs, cooperation among the sub-contracted activities, and ensuring the data and technology offer of the initiative meets internal and external needs following its vision and theory of change.     Support on user adoption of technical solutions, including analyzing the usage of the tool, and providing training and capacity building to the user community.         Build data partnerships (20%):         Identify and cultivate a set of important strategic data and technology partnerships to guide value creation for AgriAdapt and Urban Heat programs.     Manage data partnerships through data sharing agreements and data collaborative strategy.     Ensure integration of new data to the AgriAdapt web tool.       Qualifications and Requirements we seek:          Education: Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, Human-Computer Interaction or related field is equivalent practical experience in lieu of a degree is accepted.     Experience: Minimum of 5 years work experience in data-driven research and technology implementation projects involving application of geospatial analytics, remote sensing and big data is necessary.     Working knowledge of software product development, working with external vendors and leading vendor procurement process.     Experience coordinating partnerships of partners, donors, and governments.     Excellent technical documentation and communication skills, including working knowledge of Confluence, Jira, Asana or similar software ticketing systems and knowledge repositories.     Experience designing and conducting quantitative and qualitative data analysis.     High level of comfort using data visualization and storytelling tools and frameworks such as PowerBI, Flourish, Observable, MapLibre, OpenLayers, Leaflet. Familiarity with Python, CARTO, ArcGIS, or GEE.     A team player who is comfortable working with a globally distributed team across time zones, and, both with technology teams and with non-technical stakeholders.     Substantive knowledge on digital transformation, climate applications, climate-smart agriculture and latest technologies is desirable.     Detail Oriented with demonstrated organizational skills and ability to work in a timely manner.     Languages: fluency in English is important. Working knowledge of Hindi, Tamil, Telugu or other languages is beneficial.     Other requirements: Existing work authorization is required where this position is based. WRI is unable to authorize visa work authorization.

column2: About the Role: Partnering with schools mandates a 9-12 month sales funnel with different stages. Each quarter of a year requires the business to outperform on certain stages of the funnel. Add to this the complexity of schools, sales managers, markets and so on. For schools who are already a customer, there is a need to track collection, advances and profitability.  Combine the above two areas and we get an overall view of the business. You will be responsible for piecing together the above information points and be able to present a dynamic view of the business to the top management as scheduled reports and real-time on demand. You shall also play a key role in flagging any gaps in achievement or overspends basis the reports, also be responsible for deployment of monthly targets on conjunction with your reporting manager.   What you will do: Ensure sales team compliance towards properly filling out their lead details and updates on CRM Collaborate existing CRM and lead collection sources in the company to map the entire customer journey through data Build MIS/analytics reports for the business (overall, customized cuts) Work with internal stakeholders (including top management) to understand business imperatives and deliver customer reports/ analysis accordingly Operate as the leading point of contact for business data requirements within the company Point of contact for data and data-based insights for the leadership team  What you will need: Minimum a Bachelor's degree in Technical/ Statistics, masters degree is preferred 3+ years of experience in having worked in the MIS & Analytics field at a growth stage business (education sector exposure is a preference) Proficiency with Excel across reporting, formatting, pivots, data analysis, macros and VBA (experience with BI is a plus) Familiarity with functioning of popular CRM tools such as LeadSquared, Zoho, Sales force etc. Eye for detail and ability to generate insights beyond just reporting Excellent analytical and organizational skills Openness to work across departments to build-out business intelligence #hustle What you will get Industry best perks Opportunity to work closely with the leadership team Phenomenal work environment, with massive ownership and great growth opportunities Join us in shaping the future of education and empowering students with essential skills for success! Location:  Mumbai
