column2: As a key member of the enterprise data and analytics consulting team, you will help design, build, test, and deploy large scale ELT and MLOps systems for GSynergys enterprise customers. You will bring strong dev and test skills, especially in using integration services of Azure, AWS or GCP, to build fault-tolerant, scalable and traceable data movement infrastructure for real-time, near-real-time, streaming, and bulk data integration between operational, analytic, and master data management systems. You will also help with eliciting and documenting data integration requirements, documenting data integration specs and helping customers ensure data-quality and completeness. This is a full-time, remote-only position, where you will work alongside the founder and a team of highly motivated engineers distributed across India. This is not a job for Devops Cloud systems administration Machine learning / AI Required Professional Skills / Experience Bachelors degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, or the equivalent combination of education, training and experience Minimum 3 years of experience with enterprise integration using Azure, AWS or GCP cloud Experience with implementation of real-time and near real-time data integration services using Azure, AWS or GCP integration services Experience with messaging, service buses, API management, and workflows with Azure, GCP or AWS Experience with SQL databases/data warehouses such as Snowflake, Databricks, SQL Server, Postgres, Redshift, or Oracle Experience with writing OpenAPI specs, and writing automated test suites for API validation and scale testing Experience with configuring ETL/ELT data pipelines with Azure, AWS or GCP Proficiency with the use of Pyspark and SQL Proficient in writing and reviewing data integration specifications for large integration projects Experience in improving data quality through exception handling/quality control/data validation for data consumers Strong communications skills and demonstrated experience in working with all levels of IT staff at client organizations Desired Professional Skills / Experience Experience with using DBT to build data transformation pipelines Experience with retail IT systems such as ERP, warehousing, POS and e-commerce systems, BI, etc. Experience in agile delivery Experience with infrastructure as code for Azure, AWS or GCP and devops procedures for cloud infrastructure management Required Personality Traits We believe good and successful engineers Have a high degree of integrity and grit Are extremely curious, self-motivated learners Care intensely about quality and usability Have a high degree of figure it out, and know when to ask for help, and when to figure things out on their own. Like working as a member of a team, and being accountable to fellow team members. Seek and engage in open communication with peers, their reports and their leadership, about all work relevant issues and the value of what they and the company are doing. Seek responsibility, accountability, and ownership over their projects. Are capable of working hard on a consistent, day-in and day-out basis. Are ambitious, and take their career seriously. Seek career advancement. They expect their employer to invest in their career success, and in turn, they invest their time, effort, and dedication into the companies they work for. Our Hiring Process Submit Resume, and a paragraph or two about why you are interested in GSynergy, and why you think it could be a good fit. Please take a few minutes to state your proficiency with each of the above listed technical skills. If a certain salary is an absolute requirement, please don't hesitate to mention that - we want to ensure we can meet your expectations. Doing this step well will significantly improve your chances of being hired we respect people who pay attention to details. A technical challenge.  You will be required to solve it within two days, and submit a video demonstrating your solution. One or two Google Meet interviews with the team which will require you to share screen and solve technical problems on the spot Offer When it comes to how we come up with an offer, it is simple. The more you can do and the richer your experience to date, the more value you will add, and therefore the better our offer to you. We strive to be pay competitive with the market in which you are hired. Company Overview GSynergy engineers business transformations for mid to large sized enterprises, mostly in retail. Our clientele has included large brands such as Nike, Under Armour, The Home Depot and J.Crew, and several fast growing mid-sized brands such as Phantom Fireworks, Shane Co., Cato Corporation, Peter Millar and Soft Surroundings. We provide management and technology consulting services, and are also engaged in building on our extensive experience with our clients to design and build technology for the niche market of business analytics, business planning, and data engineering. Representative client engagements include Leading the assortment planning and analytics process re-engineering, functional design, build, and systems integration for a national multi-brand retailer. Designing and building a master data management and BI system that integrated customer data and insights across 80+ companies of a farm services conglomerate. Designing and building an offline-first, real-time, collaborative PWA to help a national jewelry chain streamline its stone buying process across its planners, buyers, warehousing, accounting and vendors. Replatforming the e-commerce of US' largest fireworks retailer to support connected commerce using headless technologies, serving more that 250K users a day. To learn more about what you could do at GSynergy, please reach out to us at careers@gsynergy.com No Contractors / Recruiters Please! It is a startup job requiring dedication and focus. We want folks to join us because their work is at the intersection of their own professional interests and the companys objectives, so that they are able to focus and dedicate their professional efforts to advancing the company's and their own objectives at the same time. This is why we are not looking for contractors, freelancers, or for employees planning to do freelance work alongside their employment with GSynergy. Work From Home Policy The job is 100% work from home (WFH). However, since we require high level of interaction to fuel fast paced decision making, we require that you work during the same hours as your team. We do allow for some flexibility in work hours, and highly encourage work-life balance. We want our teammates and their families to be healthy and happy, so they can focus on advancing themselves, their team, and the company. You will be responsible for your productivity. Therefore you yourself are responsible for ensuring the following about your WFH environment: Ergonomic work area, for example, work desk, chair, ample lighting, cooling and heating, etc. Fast and stable internet connection Continuous / stable electricity Reachability, for example, stable phone network Free of distractions, i.e., free of background noises, frequent visits by roommates or family Every year the entire company gets together for 3 to 4 days to celebrate is accomplishments from the past year and to bond with each other. In 2023, the team met in Kashmir. In 2022, the team met in Goa.

column2: We are looking for a Data Engineer /Data Modeler to join our team     You will be handling hundreds of millions of events per day, responsible for creating and supporting data infrastructures that will drive our business     Data Engineers are at the heart of how Fareportal works, and they are part business expert, data modelling expert and part technologist     You will focus on designing and maintaining our core data models that manage and store our most important data from which we derive much of our business decision making and facilitate our advanced data science functions to drive business outcomes     The ideal candidate will participate in the designing of data models and implementation of the entire data pipeline, from project ideation, figuring out which data to capture and store, coming up with architectures, to creating the final data sets/ data flows and monitoring     We are passionate about making data-driven decisions and you will have the opportunity to shape the team s direction and create a large impact           Responsibilities:         Own the data modeling process by understanding the business objectives that data users are looking to achieve from the data and make data model design decisions.     Own one or more Data Domains becoming the recognized content expert for that domain including understanding data consumer requirements, understand data source constraints related to this domain.     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to comprehend diverse business requirement and translate them into effective data models.     Ensure the integrity and quality of master data, implementing best practices.     Understanding of different data modelling approaches and when to use Scheme vs Relational vs Graph.     Develop, implement, and maintain data applications in various data formats and architectures.     Evaluate and ensure data integrity across various formats through mature, high-quality, well-organized code with fully developed unit and testing.           Our ideal candidate:     Who You Are       You are smart and love to build systems that are well tested as well as flexible     You like being around smart people who will challenge you on a daily basis.     Passionate about working with large unstructured and structured data sets and developing new approaches to relevance problems     You like to share your knowledge and guide other fellow data engineers and scientists         Requirements       5+ years experience data modelling including creation and maintenance of centralized master data or enterprise data models     Ideally worked in an ecommerce environment including designing and managing data models for storing and Attributing WebAnalytics / Clickstream data to drive customer behavior analytics     Ideally worked with Master Data Management solutions.     A strong technical advocate with a background in working with Data Modeling tools and SQL as language.     Built attribution models of data on how to show people interactions with websites.

column1: Opening For Data Engineer/ Data Modeler with Fareportal
column2: Who We Are: Fareportal is a travel technology company powering a next-generation travel concierge service. Utilizing its innovative technology and company owned and operated global contact centres, Fareportal has built strong industry partnerships providing customers access to over 500 airlines, a million lodgings, and hundreds of car rental companies around the globe. With a portfolio of consumer travel brands including CheapOair and OneTravel, Fareportal enables consumers to book-online, on mobile apps for iOS and Android, by phone, or live chat. Fareportal provides its airline partners with access to a broad customer base that books high-yielding international travel and add-on ancillaries. HIGHLIGHTS: Fareportal is the number 1 privately held online travel company in flight volume. Fareportal partners with over 500 airlines, 1 million lodgings, and hundreds of car rental companies worldwide. 2019 annual sales exceeded $5 billion. Fareportal sees over 150 million unique visitors annually to our desktop and mobile sites. Fareportal, with its global workforce of over 2,600 employees, is strategically positioned with 9 offices in 6 countries and headquartered in New York City.   Role Description     At Fareportal, we create technology that is driving innovation in the travel industry. Our employees are the core of our organization and together were revolutionizing the way people book travel. We are looking for a Data Engineer /Data Modeler to join our team. You will be handling hundreds of millions of events per day, responsible for creating and supporting data infrastructures that will drive our business. Data Engineers are at the heart of how Fareportal works, and they are part business expert, data modelling expert and part technologist. You will focus on designing and maintaining our core data models that manage and store our most important data from which we derive much of our business decision making and facilitate our advanced data science functions to drive business outcomes. The ideal candidate will participate in the designing of data models and implementation of the entire data pipeline, from project ideation, figuring out which data to capture and store, coming up with architectures, to creating the final data sets/ data flows and monitoring. We are passionate about making data-driven decisions and you will have the opportunity to shape the teams direction and create a large impact. Responsibilities Own the data modeling process by understanding the business objectives that data users are looking to achieve from the data and make data model design decisions.  Own one or more Data Domains becoming the recognized content expert for that domain including understanding data consumer requirements, understand data source constraints related to this domain.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to comprehend diverse business requirement and translate them into effective data models. Ensure the integrity and quality of master data, implementing best practices. Understanding of different data modelling approaches and when to use Scheme vs Relational vs Graph. Develop, implement, and maintain data applications in various data formats and architectures. Evaluate and ensure data integrity across various formats through mature, high-quality, well-organized code with fully developed unit and testing. Our ideal candidate: Who You Are You are smart and love to build systems that are well tested as well as flexible You like being around smart people who will challenge you on a daily basis. Passionate about working with large unstructured and structured data sets and developing new approaches to relevance problems You like to share your knowledge and guide other fellow data engineers and scientists Requirements 5+ years experience data modelling including creation and maintenance of centralized master data or enterprise data models Ideally worked in an ecommerce environment including designing and managing data models for storing and Attributing WebAnalytics / Clickstream data to drive customer behavior analytics  Ideally worked with Master Data Management solutions. A strong technical advocate with a background in working with Data Modeling tools and SQL as language. Built attribution models of data on how to show people interactions with websites.

column1: S&C Global Network - AI - GenAI - Marketing Analytics - Analyst
column2: Entity :- Accenture Strategy & Consulting Team :- Global Network Data & AI Practice :- Marketing Analytics  Title :- Ind & Func AI Decision Science Analyst Level 11 Job location :- Gurgaon / Bangalore / Mumbai / Hyderabad About S&C Global Network - Data & AI :- Accenture Global Network - Data & AI practice help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. We enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and help grow their business in entirely new ways through the power of Artificial Intelligence. From strategy to execution, Accenture works with organizations to develop advanced analytic capabilities. This includes everything from accessing and reporting on data to building and deploying predictive models and implementing Generative AI solutions. WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? As part of our Data & AI practice, you will join a worldwide network of smart and driven colleagues who are pioneers in leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies, including Generative AI. From data to analytics and insights to actions, our forward-thinking consultants provide analytically informed, issue-based insights at scale to help our clients improve outcomes and achieve high performance. Accenture is committed to nurturing your growth and development. You'll have access to training and mentorship from seasoned professionals, empowering you to expand your skill set and stay at the forefront of industry trends. In S&C GN - Data & AI you will understand the importance of sound analytical decision-making, how each task contributes to the overall project objectives, execute projects that contribute directly to business performance improvement and utilize Generative AI to unlock new possibilities. Qualification What you would do in this role: Harness the capabilities of Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs), to build innovative solutions. Define data requirements for leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) Perform data cleaning, aggregation, analysis, and interpretation, while conducting thorough data quality assessments. Build and manage data pipelines, ensuring efficient data flow and processing. Train and fine-tune LLMs using large-scale datasets to optimize performance and accuracy. Evaluate model performance and iterate on improvements. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate Generative AI and LLMs into end-to-end solutions, ensuring seamless deployment and scalability. Utilize cloud services from AWS, Azure, or GCP for development, training, and deployment of models. Stay updated on the latest advancements in Generative AI and explore new techniques and frameworks to enhance model capabilities and performance. Document methodologies, experiments, and findings to facilitate knowledge sharing. Collaborate closely with the team, consultants, and managers to align project objectives and deliverables. Create insights presentations and client-ready decks, effectively communicating findings and recommendations. Mentor and guide junior resources, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented team environment. Demonstrate strong communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively convey complex concepts and insights to stakeholders. Who we are looking for: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Marketing or related disciplines with an excellent academic record 2+ years of experience in Data Science, preferably within the Marketing domain. Proficiency in Python and SQL. Proven experience in implementing Generative AI use cases. Hands-on experience working with at least one prominent Large Language Model (LLM). Familiarity with at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP) for data storage, processing, and model deployment. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Ability to think critically, solve problems creatively, and translate complex technical concepts into clear and concise language for both technical and non-technical audiences. Strong desire to learn and stay up to date on the latest advancements in Generative AI and Marketing Analytics.

column2: Overview:  We are seeking a  Senior Zoho Specialist  to join our dynamic team and take charge of our  Zoho CRM  platform. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring seamless integration of digital leads from sales channels into the CRM, optimizing data dashboard visibility, and proficiently managing HR leads within the CRM environment. This role requires expertise in utilizing, customizing, and integrating Zoho CRM with other software solutions to meet the organization's evolving needs. Key Responsibilities: Zoho CRM Integration and Customization: Design and implement robust solutions for integrating digital leads from various sales channels into Zoho CRM. Customize Zoho CRM workflows, modules, and fields to align with business processes and enhance user experience. Configure automation features within Zoho CRM to streamline lead management, assignment, and follow-up processes. Data Dashboard Development: Develop comprehensive data dashboards within Zoho CRM to provide real-time insights into sales performance, lead pipelines, and other key metrics. Collaborate with stakeholders to identify reporting requirements and translate them into actionable dashboard components. Implement advanced analytics tools and techniques to extract meaningful insights from CRM data. HR Lead Management: Establish efficient processes for recording and managing HR leads within Zoho CRM, ensuring accurate tracking of candidate interactions and recruitment activities. Customize CRM functionalities to support HR-specific workflows, such as applicant tracking, interview scheduling, and onboarding. Integration with Third-Party Software: Evaluate and integrate third-party software solutions with Zoho CRM to extend its functionality and interoperability. Develop custom APIs, scripts, or connectors to facilitate seamless data exchange between Zoho CRM and other systems, such as marketing automation platforms, ERP software, or HRIS. Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users on Zoho CRM usage, best practices, and troubleshooting techniques. Develop training materials, documentation, and knowledge base articles to promote user adoption and self-service capabilities. Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of latest Zoho CRM updates, features, and industry trends to recommend and implement continuous improvements. Proactively identify areas for optimization, scalability enhancements, and process automation within the CRM ecosystem. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field. Experience in administering and customizing Zoho CRM, including lead management, workflow automation, and reporting. Proficiency in Zoho CRM development tools, such as  Deluge Scripting, Custom Functions, and API Integration. Strong understanding of CRM data architecture, relational databases, and data migration techniques. Demonstrated experience in integrating Zoho CRM with other software applications, such as marketing automation platforms (e.g., Mailchimp, HubSpot), ERP systems, or HRIS. Excellent analytical skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Effective communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to collaborate across functional teams and levels of the organization. Why Join Us: Opportunity to play a pivotal role in shaping the CRM strategy and infrastructure of a growing organization. Collaborative and supportive work environment with ample opportunities for professional growth and development. Competitive compensation package, including benefits and performance-based incentives. If you're passionate about leveraging Zoho CRM to drive business success and thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment, we'd love to hear from you! Apply now to join our team as a Senior Zoho Specialist and embark on an exciting journey of digital transformation within the Ridhira Group.

column2: Tableau Cloud Migration Engineer Job Title:  Senior Tableau Developer - Cloud Migration Location:  Hyderabad, Bangalore, Pune Experience:  3-6 Years Mandatory Skills : Tableau Server, Tableau Cloud Role Overview:  The Tableau Cloud Migration Engineer will support ongoing development and enhancement for the Tableau Cloud Migration Project. Responsibilities include planning and executing the migration of Tableau Server projects to Tableau Cloud, ensuring functionality, data quality, and security. What would you do:  Analyze data sources, connections, and dashboards for identified projects. Design and execute the migration procedure. Develop a testing strategy for validating migrated dashboards. Review and obtain sign-off from the Salesforce program manager on all migration artifacts. Integrate data sources, connections, and dashboards, and refresh user stories. Continuously automate and improve trust and governance checks for Tableau Cloud projects. Build and maintain centralized solutions for content creators. Youd be a great fit if you have:  3-6 years of experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Cloud. Strong understanding of data quality, integrity, and security principles. Experience with automation and deployment pipelines. Excellent collaboration and communication skills. Proven ability to manage complex projects and meet deadlines. Why you should choose us: Health and Wellness:? Healthcare policy covering your family and parents. Hybrid work policy:  Beat the everyday traffic commute. A 3-day in office and 2-day WFH policy based on your roles and responsibilities. Professional Development:  Learn and propel your career. We provide workshops, funded online courses and other learning opportunities based on individual needs. Rewards and Recognitions:  Recognition and rewards programs in place to celebrate your achievements and contributions. Regards, Relanto - TAG

column1: GN - SONG - MT - Generative AI - Analyst
column2: The Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song Practice | Marketing Transformation | Generative AI  Analyst Join our team of Marketing Transformation consultants who solve customer facing challenges at  clients spanning sales,  service,  and marketing to accelerate business change. Practice : The  Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song |  Areas of Work :Generative AI |  Level : Analyst  |  Location :Delhi, Mumbai,  Bangalore , Gurgaon, Hyderabad |  Years of Exp: 2 - 4  years Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture  Are you passionate about scaling businesses using in-depth frameworks and techniques to solve customer facing challenges? Do you want to design,  build  and implement strategies to enhance business performance? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest? Then, this is the right place for you! Welcome to a host of exciting global opportunities within Accenture's Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song  practice. The Practice-A Brief Sketch The  practice is aligned to the Global Network Song Practice of Accenture and works with clients across their marketing,  sales,  and services functions. As part of the team, you will provide transformation services driven by key offerings like Living Marketing, Connected Commerce and Next-Generation Customer Care. These services help our clients become living businesses by  optimizing  their marketing,  sales  and customer service strategy, thereby driving cost reduction, revenue enhancement, customer satisfaction and  impacting  front end business metrics in a positive manner. The Generative AI Consultant is an intermediate-level position  within the Marketing Transformation offering of S&C GN Song .  The Gen AI consultant  will work closely with our clients  to help  design,  build  and implement initiatives that can help enhance business performance.  The key responsibilities will be to- Support client engagements by applying Generative AI methodologies and driving data-driven decision-making.  Work closely with project manager to help ideate, formulate and finalize the best suited Gen AI led solution to address the client requirement.  Design and help develop tailored Generative AI solutions, considering specific use cases, data availability, and business objectives- need a hands-on person who has worked independently on these aspects in AI/ Gen AI domain  Liaise with technical and client teams to build, train, and fine-tune Generative AI models using state-of-the-art algorithms, ensuring model performance, accuracy, and adherence to ethical guidelines.  Demonstrate a sound functional expertise of Gen AI along with broad understanding of foundation model & LLM's.  Should have sound knowledge of Marketing domain covering from Brand, Content management, Ad-Tech, Martech, Media and Marketing operations.  Demonstrate robust problem-solving abilities by thinking strategically and creatively to identify and tackle challenges and capitalize on opportunities.  Possess knowledge and hands-on experience with data extraction, data analysis and data visualization to identify patterns, preprocess data and develop appropriate Generative AI models.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project success, including managing timelines, resources and client expectations.  Possess strong communication, presentation and analytical skills, enabling effective client engagement and stakeholder management.  Stay on top of the latest Gen AI developments and leverage the same in client conversations and engagements.  Key Skills: Strong foundation  in  Generative AI, Familiarity  with  NLP techniques and tools, such as  spaCy , NLTK, or BERT ,  Proficiency  programming languages such as Python, R, or TensorFlow is an added advantage ,  Digital customer experience, Strategic thinking, Analytical skills,  Effective communication, UX/UI design, and market research skills In addition,  in order to  excel at the role, you will need to have Understanding of business dynamics, market trends, and competitive landscapes to leverage this knowledge to align generative AI strategies with broader business objectives, facilitating meaningful digital transformation for our clients.  Strong project management abilities for the oversight of generative AI initiatives, including managing timelines, budgets, and resources to ensure the seamless implementation of projects.  Aptitude for leading and inspiring cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration, and driving alignment toward generative AI objectivesto align successful project outcomes.  Analytical skills to draw insights from extensive datasets, combining them with macroeconomic factors and competitive benchmarks, for deriving actionable insights that provide value to stakeholders.  Proficiency in working effectively within a dynamic, fast-paced environment, both offshore and onshore  Strong communication and presentation skills for effectively conveying complex AI concepts and strategies to key stakeholders, enabling informed decision-making.  Managing clients, developing relationships, and ensuring client satisfaction for the success of projects.  Demonstrate leadership qualities combined with problem-solving, organizational, and delegation skills to inspire and nurture team members, driving peak performance.  Proficiency in identifying new opportunities and crafting comprehensive solutions. Take ownership of proposals from inception to completion, contributing to the enhancement of generative AI strategy offerings.  Identify growth areas in skills, platforms, and assets to strengthen our brand's generative AI strategy offerings, keeping us at the forefront of industry innovation.  Read about us. Qualification Your experience counts! MBA from a tier 1 institute with a degree in marketing / data science or statistics. Specialization in AI, machine learning is preferred. 2-3 years of sound experience in the field of Data Science and AI Experience working with AI/ML technologies Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or TensorFlow is an added advantage Deep marketing functional and technical understanding of data analysis techniques, statistical analysis, and models for Generative AI Possess strong problem-solving skills, analytical mindset, and the ability to apply Generative AI methodologies to address complex business challenges Experience of working in a collaborative and team-oriented setup, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and client engagements Comfortable to work on large sets of data and be adept at storytelling to help buildPowerPoint narratives for client discussions Excellent verbal and written communication skills What's  in it for you? An opportunity to work on

column1: Freelance/Fee-based Solution Architect For Data & AI Practice
column2: Cognitive BI, a fast-growing US based Data and AI consulting company is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Solution Architect to join our team on a freelance basis. This unique opportunity will involve serving as an external consultant or advisor to our rapidly growing Data, Analytics, and AI consulting practice.   WHY THIS ROLE IS TAILOR-MADE FOR YOU:   Imagine utilizing your after-hours be it evenings or weekends in a unique opportunity not only to apply your skills in Solutioning & Consulting (AI/ML) but also rewards it handsomely. It's a flexible, project-based work that complements your existing commitments, allowing you to continue your primary employment while effectively utilizing your free time.    JOB DESCRIPTION You will act as a thought leader, helping US based sales team to understand client needs though the problem-solving goggles and recommend appropriate solutions. The work involves solution offering, scoping, and estimating and reviewing quality of client deliverables.  RESPONSIBILITIES:   Provide expert advice and guidance to our Data, Analytics, and AI consulting practice, helping to drive strategic initiatives and projects. Lead architectural discussions and provide guidance on best practices, risk management, and technology trends. Collaborate with internal teams to design and implement cutting-edge solutions that meet our clients' complex needs. Overlay US based sales team by providing specialist solution and domain expertise Contribute to the development of project proposals, ensuring technical feasibility and alignment with business objectives.   REQUIREMENTS:   Current working professionals with solid experience in Solutioning & Consulting within AI/ML domains providing pre-sales support. Proven experience as a Solution Architect, with a strong portfolio of problem-solving and architectural design in Data, Analytics, and/or AI.  Excellent knowledge of IT service frameworks, architectural patterns, and design principles. Strong communication skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical audiences. Relevant certifications or degrees in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field are preferred. Strong grasp of key statistics and probability concepts & how they are applied in data science or data analytics.   READY TO DIVE IN?   If you're excited by the prospect of contributing to cutting-edge projects, broadening your professional network, and enhancing your income, we'd love to hear from you. Connect with us by sending your CV.

column2: You will lead the development of data and software products that improve how we create, discover, and use data to support a more resilient and prosperous world. As the Data Solutions Architect, AgriAdapt and Urban Heat you will develop and implement data product roadmaps, managing data pipelines and overseeing the release of new features. This role is a combination of hands-on and an advisory role.     You will be supported by a team of data science, software engineering and product staff within WRI s Data Lab, and subject matter experts from WRI s Climate Resilience Practice and Ross Centre for Sustainable Cities. You will report to the Program Head - Spatial Data and Data Analytics at WRI India s Sustainable Cities and Transport program.     You will be fully remote but could become hybrid depending on the available office space where you are located.       How your day will unfold:              Translate user and stakeholders needs into technical solutions (50%):         Assist the AgriAdapt and Urban Heat project teams (Cities, Data Lab, Climate Resilience Practice) in transforming insights collected from user research activities into locally relevant data solutions that meet the requirements of the stakeholders (government, universities, civil society, user community).     Facilitate architectural and design workshops with AgriAdapt and Urban Heat project teams and stakeholders to understand project goals, propose and refine technical solutions.     Identify technical challenges related to the implementation of urban heat data applications within different stakeholders contexts (integration with existing systems, data sharing and documentation, solutions architecture).     Deliver target architecture and design documents to ensure the build of new data applications and features.         Manage the delivery of technical solutions (30%):          Lead the build of the AgriAdapt global data platform built on Resource Watch API, and our future products localized to India stakeholders needs and context.     Build and demonstrate rapid prototypes and identify technical opportunities for scaling them.     Provide technical support to Project Managers in coordinating the work of all consultants and sub-contractors, ensuring and quality delivery of expected outputs, cooperation among the sub-contracted activities, and ensuring the data and technology offer of the initiative meets internal and external needs following its vision and theory of change.     Support on user adoption of technical solutions, including analyzing the usage of the tool, and providing training and capacity building to the user community.         Build data partnerships (20%):         Identify and cultivate a set of important strategic data and technology partnerships to guide value creation for AgriAdapt and Urban Heat programs.     Manage data partnerships through data sharing agreements and data collaborative strategy.     Ensure integration of new data to the AgriAdapt web tool.       Qualifications and Requirements we seek:          Education: Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, Human-Computer Interaction or related field is equivalent practical experience in lieu of a degree is accepted.     Experience: 7 to 10 years of work experience in data-driven research and technology implementation projects involving application of geospatial analytics, remote sensing and big data is necessary.     Working knowledge of software product development, working with external vendors and leading vendor procurement process.     Experience coordinating partnerships of partners, donors, and governments.     Excellent technical documentation and communication skills, including working knowledge of Confluence, Jira, Asana or similar software ticketing systems and knowledge repositories.     Experience designing and conducting quantitative and qualitative data analysis.     High level of comfort using data visualization and storytelling tools and frameworks such as PowerBI, Flourish, Observable, MapLibre, OpenLayers, Leaflet. Familiarity with Python, CARTO, ArcGIS, or GEE.     A team player who is comfortable working with a globally distributed team across time zones, and, both with technology teams and with non-technical stakeholders.     Substantive knowledge on digital transformation, climate applications, climate-smart agriculture and latest technologies is desirable.     , Detail Oriented with demonstrated organizational skills and ability to work in a timely manner.     Languages: fluency in English is important. Working knowledge of Hindi, Tamil, Telugu or other languages is beneficial.     Other requirements: Existing work authorization is required where this position is based. WRI is unable to authorize visa work authorization.
column11: Computer science, Data analysis, Ticketing, Nutrition, Architecture, Analytics, Technical support, Remote sensing, Arcgis, Technical documentation

column2: We are seeking an experienced AI Research and Technical Lead to join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in the development and success of our Automotive Benchmarking Platform.. As the AI Research and Technical Lead, you will be responsible for spearheading the AI research efforts, providing technical leadership, and driving innovation in the field of automotive benchmarking. This is an exciting opportunity to work at the forefront of artificial intelligence and automotive technology, shaping the future of the industry.  Responsibilities: AI Research and Development: Conduct cutting-edge research in the field of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and computer vision, with a focus on automotive benchmarking. Develop innovative algorithms, models, and techniques to improve the accuracy and efficiency of the benchmarking platform. Technical Leadership: Provide technical leadership and guidance to a team of researchers and engineers working on the development of the benchmarking platform. Drive the research agenda, set technical goals, and ensure successful project execution. Platform Development: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and enhance the Automotive Benchmarking Platform. Contribute to the architecture, algorithms, and overall system design to ensure scalability, performance, and reliability. Data Analysis and Visualization: Analyze large-scale automotive data sets, extract meaningful insights, and develop visualization tools and techniques to effectively communicate the benchmarking results to stakeholders. Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing: Foster a collaborative and innovative environment by actively participating in discussions, sharing knowledge, and staying up to date with the latest advancements in AI and automotive technology. Publish research findings in relevant conferences and journals. Quality Assurance: Ensure the accuracy, robustness, and integrity of the benchmarking platform through rigorous testing, validation, and quality assurance procedures. Implement best practices and standards for data handling, model training, and evaluation.   Preferred Qualifications: Experience in developing benchmarking platforms or similar large-scale data-driven systems. Experience in BI and Analytical Models  Knowledge of cloud computing platforms and distributed systems. Experience with autonomous driving technologies, ADAS systems, or connected vehicles. Experience leading AI research and development projects from ideation to implementation Expertise in programming languages such as Python, C++, and Java Proficient in data analysis tools and techniques such as SQL, Tableau, and R Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
column11: New Product Development, AI research, AWS, Python, Data Science, Azure Cloud, tech lead

column2: This role is for our Customer Analytics team and you will be responsible to analyze and transform customer data into actionable insights for enhanced engagement and experience. Required Qualifications (Must-Haves)                7-11 years of experience in Data Analytics, Insight Generation and/or Data Science          4+ years of experience working in Large Banks/ Financial Services to translate business problems into actionable insights, with demonstratable experience of delivering strategic insights and recommendations.          Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis          Experience in leading team of Data Scientists and Analysts, providing guidance and vision in solutioning business problems, mentoring and coaching junior team members.          Keep studying and staying abreast of new and potential trends in the industry to be able to formulate the end solution with the supporting data and P&L impact.          Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis to drive the proposed solution -Leveraging the internal data expertise and coupling with industry views.          Strong stakeholder management skills, requires collaboration with peers, colleagues and mid-level to senior managers in driving data driven recommendations and strategies.          Experience in data analysis, data extraction/manipulation and loading routines using SQL, Teradata, database structures and data warehouses.          Proficient in SQL, Python, PySpark for data analysis and usage of libraries          Highly effective communication skillset: ability to convey results, concepts, and issues/challenges with us and partners / peers and non-technical marketing/business audience through executive ready presentations.          Experience with statistics and basic statistical modeling techniques (i.e., regression, decision tree, random forest, clustering, segmentation etc.)          Good Story telling competencies to create new and novel analytics approach or data visualizations to deliver Insights to target audience.          Self-motivated to identify opportunities and propose solutions to business partners.              Desired Skills:            Languages: SQL, Python, SAS/R, PySpark      BI Tools: Tableau/ Power BI/ Excel      Good knowledge of building strategic analysis using customer profiling, business segmentation, heuristics, inferential statistics, RFM analysis      Experience of working with Machine learning techniques - Segmentation, Regression, Decision Trees, Forecasting, Clustering      Financial services experience      Highly organized and proactive. Should be able to manage multiple tasks in a dynamic environment and deal with multiple priorities.      Strong conceptual and quantitative problem solving skills      Excellent written and oral communication skills, and interpersonal skills.      Tenacity and persistence to ensure compliance with tight deadlines

column1: S&C Global Network - AI - Industrial - Consultant Data Science
column2: Entity :- Accenture Strategy & Consulting Team :- Global Network Data & AI Practice :- Industrial Practice Title :- Ind & Func AI Decision Science Consultant Job location :- Bangalore, Gurgaon, Hyderabad, Chennai, Pune About S&C - Global  Network :- Accenture Strategy & Consulting Global Network - Data & AI practice help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Analytics enables our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships. From strategy to execution, Accenture works with organizations to develop analytic capabilities - from accessing and reporting on data to predictive modelling - to outperform the competition. WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Scientist to join our Industrial practice. The ideal candidate should have hands-on experience in data science within industries such as manufacturing, engineering services, industrial & heavy equipment, construction, and consumer durables. As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for developing AI models/applying GenAI techniques in areas such as predictive asset maintenance, production optimization, smart mobility, battery management systems, and connected products. What you would do in this role Develop and implement AI models to address business challenges in manufacturing, industrial equipment, engineering services, and related industries. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design solutions, and deploy models into production environments. Utilize your expertise in MES/PLM/ERP/Historian systems to integrate data sources and ensure seamless operation of AI solutions. Design and develop machine learning models using Python, with proficiency in NLP and Computer Vision techniques. Architect functional solutions and provide technical guidance to enhance the performance and scalability of AI systems. Leverage cloud platforms, with preference for Azure, and experience with GCP/AWS is also valued. Stay updated on emerging technologies and industry trends, contributing to continuous improvement initiatives within the organization. Qualification Who we are looking for? Bachelor's or master's degree in Statistics / Economics / Mathematics /Computer Science or MBA in Data Science related disciplines from Premier Colleges 3-8 years of hands-on experience in data science, with a focus on industries mentioned above. Proven track record of developing AI models in areas such as predictive maintenance, production optimization, and connected products. Strong proficiency in Python programming, with experience in NLP and Computer Vision. Exposure to MES/PLM/ERP/ Historian systems and understanding of their integration with AI solutions. Experience with cloud platforms, preferably Azure, and familiarity with GCP/AWS. Knowledge of LLM exposure and experience with tools such as ChatGPT, Llama 2, Claude 2, Hugging Face, etc., will be an advantage.

column1: GN - SONG - MT - Generative AI - Consultant
column2: The Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song Practice| Marketing Transformation| Generative AI Consultant  Join our team of Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song who solve customer facing challenges at clients spanning sales, service and marketing to accelerate business change. Practice :Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song |  Areas of Work :Generative AI for Marketing |  Level :Consultant|  Location :Gurgaon, Bangalore, Mumbai |  Years of Exp:  4-8 years Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture Do you enjoy working on transformation strategies for global clients? Are you eager to be part of a team that pushes the boundaries of what's possible and explores uncharted territories in AI research and development? Are you keen on unlocking infinite creativity with generative AI? Are you proactive and self-initiated, passionate about ground-breaking generative AI applications? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest? Then, Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song is the right place for you to explore limitless possibilities. The Practice-A Brief Sketch The Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song (S&C GN Song) practice works with clients across their marketing, sales and services and customer engagement functions. Our services help our clients become living businesses by optimizing their marketing, sales, and customer service strategy, thereby driving cost reduction, enhancing revenue, improving customer satisfaction, and impacting front end business metrics in a positive manner. Generative AI Consultant is an intermediate-level position within the Marketing Transformation offering of S&C GN Song. The Gen AI consultant will work closely with our clients to help design, build and implement initiatives that can help enhance business performance. As part of these, the consultant will be expected to drive the following: Support client engagements by applying generative AI methodologies and driving data-driven decision-making Work closely with project manager to help ideate, formulate and finalize the best suited generative AI use cases and solutions to address the client requirement Design and help strategize tailored generative AI solutions, considering specific use cases, data availability, and business objectives Collaborate and bring in structured approach with development and client teams to build and customize generative AI models. Demonstrate a sound functional expertise of gen AI along with broad understanding of foundation model & LLMs Demonstrate robust problem-solving abilities by thinking strategically and creatively to identify and tackle challenges and capitalize on opportunities Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project success, including managing timelines, resources and client expectations Communicate effectively with internal Accenture leaders, SMEs and teams to ensure a cohesive and client-centric approach. Stay on top of the latest gen AI developments and leverage the same in client conversations and engagements Create business cases, solution deals and develop proposals to bring the best of Accenture's capabilities to clients. Qualification Skills to excel at this role: Deep marketing functional and sound understanding of applications of generative AI Extensive experience working within a consulting firm providing strategic advice and solutions to organizations. Possess strong communication, presentation and analytical skills, enabling effective client engagement and stakeholder management Strong analytical skills and data-driven mindset to drive results-oriented decisions.  Strong understanding of marketing processes & operating models, with broader knowledge of brand, content management, ad-tech, martech, media and marketing operations. Experience of working in a collaborative and team-oriented setup, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and client engagements Comfortable working on large sets of data Be adept at storytelling to help build powerpoint narratives for client discussions Excellent verbal and written communication skills Your experience counts! MBA from a tier 1 institute with specialization in marketing Additional courses in data science/ML/AI is a bonus 4 to 8 years of work experience Min 2 years of experience in marketing Experience with data science/ AI/ machine learning is an added advantage What's in it for you? An opportunity to work on transformative projects with key G2000 clients. Potential to Co-create with leaders in strategy, industry experts, enterprise function practitioners and, business intelligence professionals to shape and recommend innovative solutions that leverage emerging technologies. Ability to embed responsible business into everythingfrom how you service your clients to how you operate as a responsible professional. Personalized training modules to develop your strategy & consulting acumen to grow your skills, industry knowledge and capabilities Opportunity to thrive in a culture that is committed to accelerate equality for all. Engage in boundaryless collaboration across the entire organization. Location: Pune

column1: Sr. Principal Consultant Engineer - Refinery Economics
column2: We are seeking a Sr Principal Consultant/Engineer within our Global Professional Services organization based in Pune, India whose primary responsibility is to provide consulting services to customers as part of our petroleum supply chain team     This position will focus on the deployment of AspenTech s petroleum planning and scheduling solutions to our global Oil and Gas customers     This is a unique position for an exceptional Engineer to work on project implementation working closely with customers using our suite of supply chain solutions to help them operate faster and greener     The Senior Principal Consultant will execute project work from project start to finish and would require travelling to customer locations as needed     Travel for projects could be International           Your Impact         Gathering customer requirements and translating those into high-level solution designs for Aspen Petroleum supply chain suite of products     Demonstrate strong technical and business knowledge when customer facing to promote our Professional Services capabilities and our best practice methodologies that deliver value     Deliver technical documents such as Functional Specifications, Detailed Design Documents, as well as Site Acceptance Test Documents (or UAT)     With your experience in refining economics and optimization, strategic planning, or crude oil trading, you will assist customers in constructing and enhancing models. Streamline their day-to-day workflow and maintenance processes for improved efficiency.     Be confident, capable and possess ability to lead technical role on projects.     Must be a team player, collaboration is key with AspenTech Project Managers, involving technical to non-technical aspects of the project     Defining and developing Services solutions that meet the needs of our customers     Working with clients to implement the solution (from model development to adding enhancements to meet key business needs)     Commissioning the completed models which would require on site monitoring and analysis, and user handholding     Ability to lead and drive the project through completion while working in collaboration with Project Manager and second engineer as well as the customer team members     Business acumen: would participate in commercial proposal development and build relationships with customers through each interaction.      Provide training as needed to customers or facilitate formal training classes in support of CST, participate in new version testing to support Product Management team               What Youll Need        12+ years of work or graduate programs experience implementing supply chain systems in the Oil and Gas industry; Chemical Engineering or Petroleum Engineering BS degree or higher     Experience with implementation of planning and scheduling models for Petroleum Industry using AspenTech Petroleum Supply Chain suit or other 3rd party equivalent solutions     Ability to travel (25% travel on a calendar basis - when travel is required by the customer)     Process and economic understanding with minimum of 9-10+ years of professional experience in oil and refinery industries, with an in-depth understanding of crude, gas, NGL and refinery processing units     Technical programming Dot net or Javascript background is a plus     Experience with systems integration is nice to have     Experience with working with MS SQL Server or other databases is expected in this role     Excellent communication and presentation skills     Excellent problem-solving skills; have high curiosity to self-motivate; possess growth mindset     Have demonstrated leadership capabilities in previous endeavors; and is a team player     Fluent in English written and verbal. Bi-lingual skills are a big bonus     Experience with Aspen Technology APS or PIMS suite of products is highly favored

column2: Shift Timings: 2.00 PM to 11.00 PM   Job Description:   Project Overview:  Seeking a contractor who has extensive experience in Data Engineering. Data engineer will be responsible for using SQL and other programming languages to pull data from a variety source into a central data platform. They must collaborate with team members and stakeholders to understand data requirements and use that to effectively structure datasets and develop metrics. Data Engineer should be an expert in SQL and data Modeling. They must be a self-starter who is able to collaborate with team members and stakeholders, develop effective solutions, and present findings.   Aim of Role:  - Collaborate with team members and stakeholders to understand data and metric requirements  - Pull data from a variety of sources into a central data platform  - Structure datasets and calculate metrics based on requirements  - Develop automated scripts to automate otherwise manual processes  - Communicate concerns and data findings as they arise to the appropriate team members or stakeholders  - Present data findings and solutions in a way that is easy for non-technical team members and stakeholders to understand   Qualifications:  -A College or University degree and/or relevant proven work experience is required.  - Minimum of 3 years of Data Engineering Experience   Tasks & Responsibilities:  - Collaborate with team members and stakeholders to understand data and metric requirements  - Pull data from a variety of sources into a central data platform  - Structure datasets and calculate metrics based on requirements  - Develop automated scripts to automate otherwise manual processes  - Communicate concerns and data findings as they arise to the appropriate team members or stakeholders  - Present data findings and solutions in a way that is easy for non-technical team members and stakeholders to understand   Experience level: (Level 3)  7 + Exp   Mandate Skills (Min 3 years exp with below mandate skills)  - Minimum of 3 years of Data Engineering Experience  - Must be an expert in SQL  - Must be an expert in data modeling  - Python experience is a plus  - Excellent oral and written communication skills  - Self-starter with analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills  - Must be highly flexible and adaptable to change
column11: Data Engineering, Data Modeling, SQL

column2: The On-Account Data Steward plays a key role in supporting the data governance program with a strong focus on Data Quality for one of Cushman and Wakefield s accounts.     They are responsible for supporting the establishment and maintenance of an effective data governance framework, ensuring data quality, integrity, compliance, data stewardship, and metadata management activities.     With a deep understanding of data management principles, the On-Account Data Steward collaborates with the On-Account Data Governance Lead and stakeholders to align data governance practices with business objectives and pave the way for a data-driven culture within the organization             Job Description           Responsibilities:         Support the On-Account Data Governance Lead across data governance and data quality initiatives required for Cushman and Wakefield s client       Implement and enforce data quality standards and best practices for the client s common data model (Core Meta Model)         Serve as a key point of contact for matters related to data quality within the client s Core Meta Model         Ensure that data within the client s Core Meta Model adheres to defined standards and guidelines.         Conduct data profiling and analysis to identify data quality issues and anomalies.          Work with business units to understand data usage and requirements, ensuring alignment with data quality objectives.          Utilize data profiling tools and methodologies to maintain a high level of data integrity.          Support the On-Account Data Governance Lead in establishing and maintaining data quality monitoring processes         Develop and implement data quality dashboards and reports for ongoing monitoring.          Proactively identify potential data quality issues and take preventive actions.          Document data quality rules, standards, and procedures for the client s Core Meta Model       Contribute to the development and enhancement of the overall data governance framework     Collaborate with data domain owners, data stewards and business units to identify critical data elements and their relationships.     Participate in the creation and maintenance of data governance policies, procedures, and guidelines.     Collaborate with members of the data governance working group on data quality initiatives     Support the implementation of metadata standards and ensuring adherence across the core meta model     Establish clear communication channels with data owners to ensure data stewardship and quality maintenance.     Support the On-Account Data Governance Lead in tracking and monitoring data governance metrics, data quality metrics/scorecards, and KPIs.             Qualifications Experience:         Bachelor s degree in Business, Engineering, or a degree with relevant disciplines such as information management, mathematics/statistics, business information systems       Minimum 5 years of experience in the domain (with 3+ years in commercial real estate), specifically experience in:       Multiple years of experience in collaborating on Data Governance frameworks; or     Experience with building queries or tooling to report on Data Quality statistics; or     Experience with contributing in Data Compliance activities         Expert skills in Tableau, Data Quality     Intermediate skills in DataIKU, Metadata Management, Reference Data Management, Agile/Program Management, Master Data Management, Stakeholder Management, Communications Training     Foundational knowledge in Data Security, Data Sovereignty, Risk Management             Additional Skills Personal Qualities:         Excellent communication in English     Excellent logical and analytical skills - the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights from data.     Great attention to detail, diligent, focused, and highly analytical with the curiosity and drive to solve problems.     Strong mathematical numeracy skills     Thoughtful, collaborative, and proactively ready to engage with stakeholders across the globe     Committed, able to work to deadlines, prioritise and juggle between tasks     Business writing and reporting skills     Able to communicate effectively at all levels, including the ability to negotiate and resolve conflict.     Experience in documenting business processes in the form of process maps and step-by-step user manuals.     Experience in supporting system testing with entry and exist criteria.     Commitment to quality and a thorough approach to work.     Workshop facilitation skills for requirements gathering analysis.     Ability to build maintain effective working relationships with internal and external personnel.     Demonstrate flexibility and ability to deliver.     Ability to produce high quality documentation (reports, specifications, requirements, etc.)     Good team player, also able to work independently.
column11: Data management, Analytical, Agile, Data quality, Information management, Risk management, Stakeholder management, Monitoring, commercial real estate

column2: Perform a broad range of studies and other consulting services to support electric utilities and asset developers to make decisions backed by business and engineering analysis regarding their investments and power supply requirements, such as integrated resource planning, market assessments, valuations, and power supply RFP evaluations.   Researching about the US power markets (PJM, MISO, NEISO, SPP, CAISO, WECC, SERC, ERCOT, NYISO) and assisting for the production cost & capacity expansion models development which can be utilized for the power price forecasting and congestion & curtailment risk evaluation.   Perform forecasts and evaluations utilizing power supply planning software such as capacity optimization and hourly dispatch software models.   Extracting key operational characteristics and market assumptions from internal sources and third-party databases like S&P Global and Velocity Suite.   Analyze life-cycle costs by developing and incorporating technical assumptions regarding capital costs, operation and maintenance costs, performance estimates, and economic assumptions and forecasts.   Conduct technical and business-related risk assessments that evaluate impacts associated with rules implemented by regulatory agencies.   Developing presentation materials that communicate clearly the analyses performed and conveying insights that help developers better serve their utility customers.   Support multiple ad hoc projects inclusive of those above, completing them in a timely manner.   Knowledge of US power market is preferred.   Strong understanding of the economics underlying electric power generation and background in power sector modeling, resource cost-benefit analysis, or related complex system modeling.   Experience in evaluating complex technical and financial issues independently, developing recommendations, action plans, and managing multiple complex assignments simultaneously.   Strong attention to detail, facilitation, team building, collaboration, organization and problem-solving skills.   Ability to work methodically and analytically in a quantitative problem-solving environment.   Strong data management, analysis, and presentation skills (Excel, PowerPoint)   Excellent written and oral communications skills.   A willingness to learn new service offerings as client needs and the market requires changes to the service offerings provided by our group EXPERIENCE:   Experience with production cost models (PLEXOS, PROMOD, etc.) is preferred.   Strong understanding of US power market economics.   Sophisticated data management and statistical analysis skills using Excel VBA, Power BI, R and Python  - QUALIFICATION:   Bachelors or Master?? degree in Power / Energy systems is preferred or bachelor?? in electrical engineering is must.   Prior experience associated with electric utility operations, planning, or consulting is preferred.

column2: This position is in the company s Patent Analytics Monetization unit     The position requires a creative, inquisitive, and technologically adept individual who will work closely with the RD, legal and IP teams of our customers to drive and support their IP portfolio development, as patent analyst/searcher     The candidate will assist our clients with the successful procurement of patent protection for innovative technologies, through various methods of patent analytics searching     The candidate will be required to participate in client calls, present the search strategy, participate in scoping of the project, value-add through their technical expertise and specialization areas     Each Clairvolex client brings novel and diverse technologies as our work assignment     Therefore, the candidate will learn about a variety of new technologies, in addition to their specialization, learn to identify inventive features, learn to describe the inventions, and learn to draw analysis and insights to support our clients to get a patent granted or to support them in their search, analytics and licensing needs     The position is based out of Clairvolex s Gurgaon office and the team operates in hybrid mode, with 3-days mandatory work from office                 Job Responsibilities:           Patent Search Analytics:    Conducting IP searches based on complex search strategies using various search engines for prior art identification, knock-out searches, FTO clearance, invalidity, and providing a logical and complete search strategy for client projects.           IP Market Intelligence Studies:    Leading the analysis of identified new technology and market opportunities and developing recommendations on those opportunities for market, IP, and competitive landscape studies.           Patent Licensing Support Analysis:    Performing infringement search, portfolio ranking and taxonomization, evidence of use (EOU) preparation, competition intelligence, technology scouting etc independently. Should be able to work on Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, Filters, Conditional Formatting, Charts, Functions etc          Ability to apply technical knowledge or guidance, analyse and interpret data from several sources, and solve problems by applying precedent or extrapolating from previous experience.         Demonstrated attention to detail.         Education Qualification Work Experience:         Bachelor or Master of Engineering (B.Tech/ M.Tech) in any of the following domains - Electronics, Communications, VLSI from an accredited university.         Minimum 6 years of relevant IP experience in patent search analytics.

column2: Restricted Party Compliance Analyst - Chinese language Specialist Description - Job Summary This role is responsible for researching and interpreting international trade laws, supporting compliance investigations, and providing guidance on trade requirements. The role aids in deploying trade compliance strategies across business units and maintains accurate compliance records. The role contributes proactively through research, data analysis, and knowledge sharing, independently resolving issues while adhering to company policies. Responsibilities Researches and interprets international trade laws and regulations. Applies knowledge of trade compliance requirements on low to medium complexity systems. Supports investigation of trade compliance incidents with low to medium complexity. Participates in providing guidance to business units and global functions on trade compliance requirements. Supports deployment of trade compliance strategies, policies and procedures in business units and global functions. Supports special trade compliance projects to ensure policies, controls, and procedures remain up to date with legal and regulatory changes. Maintains organized and up-to-date records of trade transactions, licenses, permits, and other compliance-related documents. Develops conclusions, recommendations, and written reports, contributing proactively through research and data analysis support, and sharing knowledge to foster a knowledge management culture. Works independently on moderate scope problems, applying professional expertise, exercising judgment, and resolving various issues by following company policies and procedures. Education & Experience  Recommended Four-year or Graduate Degree in Law, Business Administration, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence. Typically has 2-4 years of work experience, preferably in trade compliance, customs global trade, or a related field or an advanced degree with little or no work experience. Preferred Certifications NA Knowledge & Skills Chinese Language Specialist Cross-Org Skills Effective Communication Results Orientation Learning Agility Digital Fluency Customer Centricity Impact & Scope Impacts immediate team and acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input. Complexity Responds to routine issues within established guidelines. Disclaimer This job description describes the general nature and level of work performed in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, responsibilities, knowledge, etc. These may be subject to change and additional functions may be assigned as needed by management. Shift - No shift premium (India)

column2: Data Scientist Bangalore, GHQ - GAC - GAC JOB DESCRIPTION AB InBev GCC was incorporated in 2014 as a strategic partner for Anheuser-Busch InBev. The center leverages the power of data and analytics to drive growth for critical business functions such as operations, finance, people, and technology. The teams are transforming Operations through Tech and Analytics. Do You Dream Big? We Need You. Job Title: Data Scientist Analytics Domain: Analytics Reporting to: Manager- Analytics/ Senior Manager-Analytics 1.Purpose of the role Anheuser-Busch InBev (AB InBev)s Category Management Analytics team is responsible for building competitive differentiated solutions that improve profitability, revenue or save costs in our Sales capabilities (Clustering, assortment optimization, price and promo optimization, shelf space planning, e-commerce, omni-channel analytics, macro-space planning, to name a few). As a data scientist, you will work at the intersection of (a) application of machine learning/deep learning solutions (b) making actionable insights out of large sets of diverse data (c) use DevOps best practices that include model serving, code versioning and other developer tooling. As a bonus, you will build new product features from start to finish (e.g., develop and deploy new demand models served into production systems). You will also review and influence the engineering design, architecture, and technology stack across multiple products, outside your immediate focus. 2. Key Tasks and Accountabilities ??You are expected to explore and develop ML algorithm to improve the existing methodology, model accuracy etc. ??You will work on building code that will deploy into production, using code design and style standards. ??You will document your thought process and create artefacts on team repo/wiki that can be used to share with business and engineering for sign-off. ??You will review code quality, designed, and developed by your peers. ??You will significantly improve the performance and reliability of our code that create high quality and reproducible results. You will also develop internal tools/utils that improve productivity of entire team. ??You will collaborate with other team members to advance teams ability to ship high quality code, fast! ??You should be able to mentor/coach junior team members to continuously upskill them. ??You will maintain basic developer hygiene that includes but not limited to, writing tests, using loggers, readme to name a few. 3. Qualifications, Experience, Skills - Academic degree in, but not limited to, Bachelors or Masters in engineering (CS), data science, statistics, applied mathematics, mathematics, economics, etc. - Beyond academic degrees, we give more weightage to 3+ years of real-world experience in Data science / building ML models. You should have expertise in the following: -  Strong at Python coding (pandas, numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, statsmodels, tensorflow.) -  Good foundation  in supervised and unsupervised  ML models -  Proficiency with classical approaches to machine learning, linear algebra & mathematical optimization. - Excellent understanding of science fundamentals (experimental design, hypothesis testing, reproducibility). -  Exposure to working in VSC, PyCharm & DataBricks -  Experience in code versioning using Git (or alike), maintaining modularized code base for multiple deployments. - Experience in working in Agile environment. - Basic knowledge of object-oriented design and concepts - Basic understanding of any public cloud, RESTful APIs & containerization. - We expect you to challenge status quo with an owners mindset of what can break and think of proactively fixing it. - You need to have bias for action and make right trade-offs between solution design and solving business needs. And above all of this, an undying love for beer! We dream big to create future with more cheers.

column1: SAP To Hadoop Data Pipeline Engineer
column2: Job Description : We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Pipeline Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from SAP systems into our Hadoop cluster. You will work closely with cross-functional teams including data engineers, SAP administrators, and business analysts to ensure efficient and reliable data transfer and integration. Responsibilities : Design, develop, and implement data pipelines to extract data from SAP systems using various methods such as SAP Data Services, SAP HANA, SAP BW, or custom extraction programs. Transform and cleanse data as per business requirements to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity. Optimize data extraction and loading processes to minimize latency and maximize throughput. Collaborate with SAP administrators to understand SAP data models, configurations, and data extraction capabilities. Work closely with data engineers to integrate SAP data into our Hadoop ecosystem, including HDFS, Hive, and Spark. Monitor pipeline performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure data pipeline reliability and scalability. Document data pipeline processes, configurations, and dependencies for knowledge sharing and future reference. Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in data engineering, SAP integration, and big data processing.   Requirements  : 8+ years of experience. Proven experience in building data pipelines and ETL processes, preferably from SAP systems to Hadoop or other big data platforms. Strong understanding of SAP data structures, modules, and integration technologies. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala for data manipulation and scripting. Hands-on experience with Hadoop ecosystem components such as HDFS, Hive, Spark, and Kafka. Experience with data integration tools like SAP Data Services, Informatica, or Talend is a plus. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment, with a passion for continuous learning and improvement. If you are passionate about data engineering, enjoy working with complex data sets, and thrive in a collaborative team environment, we would love to hear from you.
column11: Hive, Hadoop, Hadoop Cluster, Sap Hana, Hdfs, Data Pipeline, Big Data, Kafka, Sap Data Services, Spark, Sap Integration, ETL

column2: Eninrac is looking for a research analyst who will be a part of our research & consulting (R&C) team     The candidate will be working for energy industry practice     As a research analyst in the energy industry practice, you will be working on strategic, analytical and operational topics likely focusing on many elements surrounding electric power, transmission & distribution (T&D), retail markets, renewable energy & energy transition including green hydrogen, BESS, oil & gas,coal etc     The candidate will be required to research and synthesize actionable insights in response to complex research questions posed by our consulting teams and clients, leveraging a solid understanding of business and technology trends, issues and concepts in the conventional & non converntional energy domain           Responsibilities        You will collect and analyze data and information found in primary and secondary research domains.     You will assemble the relevant fact base, counsel consultants and clients on the scope of business operations, technology, and strategic and economic trends within the electricity and broader energy transition space, and provide insights and analysis for solving our clients problems.     Some of your day-to-day tasks will include to develop & manage Eninracs properietary data tool/(s) in the energy domain, capturing daily insights upon Eninracs properietary platform Einfews relevant to your industry domain.     Developing the data tools shall be a timeline bound job & managing the updates of information/insights/analyses shall be a cyclic practices.     Furthermore, the day-to-day tasks will include working upon Eninracs ecosystem research reports - this will be a cyclic task and releasing updated reports quarterly for the clients shall be the sole responsibility of the candidate.     The ecosystem reports shall include analyses such as benchmarking, trend identification, industry profiling, market sizing, growth projections, opportunity scanning, etc     you'll also provide synthesis, insight and client implications within tight deadlines via end products in the form of PowerPoint charts, written memos, models and frameworks.     You will assisting senior team members with the desired inputs on the industry.     Working as a team player and willing to work in a cross functional team environment when required.     Supporting sales team in preparing the desired pitch for the ecosystem reports/ data tools to the clients. Assisting them in client calls & supporting them with desired sample extracts of the reports.           Requirements & Skills       Bachelors in economics/business administration/engineering with a very good academic record.     Relevant upto 2 years of work experience in the energy sector (conventional & non-conventional energy domain) & understaning of basic terminonlogies and concepts of the said industry domain.     Experience of working on industry research reports and data tools.     Strong problem-solving skills and conceptual abilities.     Capabilities in collection, analysis and synthesis of information and knowledge.     Service-oriented personality, intellectual curiosity and an investigative mind.     Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively.     Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.     Strong multitasking abilities.     Excellent communication skills in English.     Proficiency MS office - word/PPT/excel is necessary
